For example, when a user does not have a salary permission, then the creditor side of the payment will not be returned.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="approver" type="ct:ApproverType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Users who has approved</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="agreementDetails" type="ct:AgreementDetails"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Filter payments based on agreement type</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="marketType" type="st:MarketType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Indicates if payment has been generated from corporate (BM) or retail (PM) channel</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="originalChannel" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The channel the payment was originally received/created from</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="paymentAdditionalInfo" type="ct:PaymentAdditionalInfo"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Payment additional info services associated with this payment.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="CreditTransferTransactionRequestType"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="cre:CreditTransferTransaction"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="remittanceInformationUnstructured" type="st:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information supplied to enable the matching/reconciliation of an entry with the items that the payment is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system, in an unstructured form."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditorScorReference" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Used to reference OCR/KID
The ISO reference is RemittanceInformation.Structured.CreditorReferenceInformation.Code/Reference=SCOR, and has been flattened here.
SCOR = StructuredCommunicationReference: Document is a structured communication reference provided by the creditor to identify the referred transaction.
ISO: "Unique reference, as assigned by the creditor, to unambiguously refer to the payment transaction. Usage: If available, the initiating party should provide this reference in the structured remittance information, to enable reconciliation by the creditor upon receipt of the amount of money. If the business context requires the use of a creditor reference or a payment remit identification, and only one identifier can be passed through the end-to-end chain, the creditor's reference or payment remittance identification should be quoted in the end-to-end transaction identification."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="nationalSpecificPaymentRequestInformation" type="ct:NationalSpecificPaymentRequestInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Non-ISO: All information specific to the nation for the payment request can be sent here. See for example: urn:pays.payment.evry.com:domain:nationalinformation:nor:v1 NorwegianPaymentRequestInformation type which contains AvtaleGiro/eInvoice agreement capture, receipt requests, etc. in Norway.
(Note: in the ISO20022 standard, this information could be put in the supplementaryData field)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="CreditTransferTransactionResponseType"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="cre:CreditTransferTransaction"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="remittanceInformation" type="ct:RemittanceInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Invoice details</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="nationalSpecificPaymentInformation" type="ct:NationalSpecificPaymentInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Non-ISO: All information specific to the nation for the payment request can be sent here. See for example: urn:pays.payment.evry.com:domain:nationalinformation:nor:v1 NorwegianPaymentInformation type which contains AvtaleGiro/eInvoice agreement capture, receipt requests, etc. in Norway.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> </xs:schema> <xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="urn:pays.payment.evry.com:domain:nationalinformation-nor:v1_1" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:tns="urn:pays.payment.evry.com:domain:nationalinformation-nor:v1_1" xmlns:ct="urn:pays.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-complex-types:v6"> <xs:import namespace="urn:pays.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-complex-types:v6"/> <xs:complexType name="NorwegianPaymentRequestInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Non-ISO Norwegian specific payment request information</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="ct:NationalSpecificPaymentRequestInformation"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="agreementCapture" type="tns:AgreementCaptureType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>If the beneficiary offers AvtaleGiro agreements, eInvoice agreements, or both, this might be fetched at payment time and a proposal presented. Use this field to control the proposal fetch. If not defined, no agreement capture will be performed. AVTALEGIRO to fetch potential AvtaleGiro proposals, COMBINATION for fetching proposal which offer both products (e.g. an AvtaleGiroPayment with eInvocing reference). Should only be used for payments with CID defined. If this value is given, a possible agreement capture proposal will be returned in the response for the given AgreementCaptureType. This should only be used for payments with CID defined (see creditorScorReference).</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="receiptOrder" type="tns:ReceiptType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>If this value is given, a receipt will be ordered for the given type. Even though this is available in the paymentUpdateMessage, if this is the only field to update for the payment, consider rather using the PINSPaymentUtil.ReceiptOrderUpdate web service operations which also supports creating receipt orders after the payment has been completed.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="eInvoiceDetails" type="ct:EinvoiceDetails"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>eInvoice details for payments using eInvoice</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="NorwegianNationalPaymentInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Non-ISO Norwegian specific payment information</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="ct:NationalSpecificPaymentInformation"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="agreementProposalCapture" type="tns:AgreementProposalCapture"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Object containing information relevant to agreement capture. I.e. if the payer is registering a bill to a beneficiary offering AvtaleGiro, the payer could be offered an AvtaleGiro proposal immediately.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="receiptOrder" type="tns:ReceiptType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>If this value is given, a receipt will be ordered for the given type. Even though this is available in the paymentUpdateMessage, if this is the only field to update for the payment, consider rather using the PINSPaymentUtil.ReceiptOrderUpdate web service operations which also supports creating receipt orders after the payment has been completed.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="EProviderProposal" type="tns:EProviderProposal"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Contains information about name and status of eInvoice providers.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="eInvoiceDetails" type="ct:EinvoiceDetails"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>eInvoice details for payments using eInvoice</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType abstract="true" name="AgreementProposalCapture"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generic type for all agreement proposal captures</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AvtaleGiroProposalCapture"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Present if a new AvtaleGiro agreement proposal is captured.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="tns:AgreementProposalCapture"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="ProposalId" type="xs:int"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The AvtaleGiro proposal id</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EInvoiceProposalCapture"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Present if a new eInvoice agreement proposal is captured.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="tns:AgreementProposalCapture"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="ProviderId" type="xs:string"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The eFaktura issuer's unique Id inside the Norwegian eFaktura B2C solution.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="BrandId" type="xs:string"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The brand id to the eFaktura provider.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="BrandName" type="xs:string"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The name of the eFaktura provider</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="CustomerReference" type="xs:string"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Consumer electronic invoice reference. A unique identification of the customer to the eFaktura provider.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="ProposalId" type="xs:int"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The eFaktura proposal id</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="CombinationProposalCapture"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Contains both a eInvoiceProposalCapture and an AvtaleGiroProposalCapture</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="tns:AgreementProposalCapture"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="EInvoiceProposalCapture" type="tns:EInvoiceProposalCapture"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Present if a new eFaktura agreement proposal is captured.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="AvtaleGiroProposalCapture" type="tns:AvtaleGiroProposalCapture"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Present if a new AvtaleGiro agreement proposal is captured.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EProviderProposal"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="EInvoiceProvider" nillable="true" type="tns:EInvoiceProviderEnum"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The eInvoice provider which is registered on the customer.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="Status" nillable="true" type="tns:EProviderStatusEnum"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The status on this agreement with the einvoice provider.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="DatePostponed" nillable="true" type="xs:date"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The customer has answered no to sign an agreement with eInvoice provider. The customer will be asked again after this date.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="AgreementCaptureType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="AVTALEGIRO"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Use this value in the request to fetch potential AvtaleGiro agreement proposals</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="COMBINATION"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Use this value in the request for fetching proposals which offer both products (e.g. an AvtaleGiroPayment with eInvoicing reference)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="EInvoiceProviderEnum"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="EINVOICE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Agreement from Nets</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DIGIPOST"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Agreement from Posten</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ECOMMERCE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Agreement from ECOMMERCE</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="EBOX"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Agreement from EBOX</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="EProviderStatusEnum"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="PROSPECT"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Agreement with provider, but no agreement with the bank</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ACTIVE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Agreement with provider and bank</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="POSTPONED"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>An agreement with the bank is not wanted now</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="INACTIVE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Agreement with provider is canceled</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="NOPROSPECT"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>No agreement with provider</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ReceiptType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="STICKER"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Receipt sticker</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PRINT"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Printed receipt</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="NONE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>No receipt</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:schema> </wsdl:types> <wsdl:definitions targetNamespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:ws:paymentstatusupdate:v1_5" xmlns:wsdl="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/" xmlns:tns="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:ws:paymentstatusupdate:v1_5" xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/soap/" xmlns:sch5="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:payment-status-update:v1_5" xmlns:sch4="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-complex-types:v7" xmlns:sch3="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-simple-types:v6" xmlns:sch2="urn:pays.payment.edb.com:domain:edb-types:v1" xmlns:sch1="http://edb.com/ws/WSCommon_v21" xmlns:sch0="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:ws:paymentstatusupdate:v1_5"> <wsdl:types> <xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:ws:paymentstatusupdate:v1_5" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:pin="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:payment-status-update:v1_5" xmlns:edb="urn:pays.payment.edb.com:domain:edb-types:v1"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Operations for updating status of payments. All operations can be performed on message, account, paymentInformation and transcation level. Short explanation of the statuses (see supplementary documentation for further details) Confirm: validated -> toBeApproved | validated -> readyForDueDate (if approval is not used) Approve: toBeApproved -> readyForDueDate | toBeApproved -> toBeApproved (if more than 1 approval needed) Unapprove: readyForDueDate -> toBeApproved Cancel: * -> cancelled Prioritize: readyForDueDate -> readyForDueDate w/priority mark Unprioritize: readyForDueDate w/priority mark -> readyForDueDate Stop: readyForDueDate -> stopped Reactivate: stopped -> readyForDueDate Verify: validated -> verificationNeeded IgnoreLimit: stopped (due to payment over agreement limit) -> readyForDueDate Force funds: release a payment and skip funds check . Bank user must have access to override coverage control when registering payment instructions or free posting. Error Conditions (responseState.ErrorCode): 70=Technical error (Uncategorized) 6426=No payments found for status update (Validation) 6485=Not authorized for accounts (Validation) 6549=Required account identification (Account as input) 6600=Status update failed for all matching payments. Refer to ResultCode of individual StatusUpdateResults for detailed information
Validation conditions (responseState.ErrorCode) 6601=Status update failed for some matching payments. Refer to ResultCode of individual StatusUpdateResults for detailed information
In case of 6600/6601, see errorCode, errrorMessage and severity for each payment. This corresponds to items normally found in the standard ResponseStateType, but since there is the possible for multiple payments for each status update operation, each error is specific to each payment transaction.
If no payments matches the requested criteria, an error will be thrown. If at least one payment fulfills the requested criteria, a validation error will be added for each failing payment.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:import namespace="urn:pays.payment.edb.com:domain:edb-types:v1"/> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:payment-status-update:v1_5"/> <xs:element name="PaymentApproveRequest" type="tns:PaymentApproveRequestType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Request to Approve payment(s)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="PaymentApproveResponse" name="PaymentStatusResponseType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>If there are more than 500 records updated, only paymentStatusUpdateSummary will be included in the response and no paymentStatusUpdateResult will be returned. If less than 500 records, both paymentStatusUpdateSummary and paymentStatusUpdateResult elements will be returned.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="edb:baseResponseType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="paymentStatusUpdateSummary" type="pin:PaymentStatusUpdateSummaryItem"/> <xs:element maxOccurs="500" minOccurs="0" name="paymentStatusUpdateResult" type="pin:PaymentStatusUpdateResult"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> </xs:schema> <xsd:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="http://edb.com/ws/WSCommon_v21" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns="http://edb.com/ws/WSCommon_v21"> <xsd:complexType name="ClientContextType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="userid" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies the person who initiated the action This could either be the customer itself in a netbank) or an employee</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="credentials" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Authorization data. This is typically a security Object retriewed from a logon, but can also be a plain password.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="channel" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicated what type of application that initiated the request</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="orgid" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The OrganizationalId - will in a banking context be Financial Institution / Konsernnr</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="orgunit" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Organizational unit will in a banking context be Branch / Registernr</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="customerid" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Id of the customer on which the operation is requested, may be the same as userid, but may well be different</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="locale" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Locale in a java syntax e.g "en_EN". May be used if application supports localized response</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ip" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The ip adress of the client</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="item" nillable="true" type="itemType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Optionnal extention items - Add key/value pairs for application specific extentions</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="itemType"> <xsd:attribute name="key" type="xsd:string" use="required"/> <xsd:attribute name="value" type="xsd:string" use="required"/> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="EDBHeaderType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="SourceApplication" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies the source that initiated the message. Used to separate different service consumers.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="DestinationApplication" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies the destination of the message. Used to separate different service providers.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Function" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies the service to be called.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Version" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Service version "X.Y.Z" according to this standard: X = Main release (major changes, not necessarily backwards compatible) Y = Minor release (backwards compatible, new functionality) Z = Bugfix (backwards compatible, error correction only)</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ClientContext" type="ClientContextType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Elements for identifying client context information.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:element name="AutHeader" type="EDBHeaderType"/> <xsd:complexType name="ResponseStateType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="ErrorCode" type="xsd:int"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Numeric error code reported for this error.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Severity" type="xsd:int"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Response Status Severity Code</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ComponentId" type="xsd:int"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Unique code identifying the component returning the service response</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="StrErrorCode" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Deprecated: Error code represented as String</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Message" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Message describing the error. Default is english language. Optionally localized according to the locale parameter in the service request</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="NativeError" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Deprecated: Optional detailed error information reported from involved components. Used for diagnostics purposes.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="LogSequence" nillable="true" type="xsd:long"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Optional key generated to be used for log correlation purposes.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" This service level will indicate that the payment initiation system should mark the eInvoice as ready for due date/paid in the external system, i.e. NETS. <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>einvoice from EBOX</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="UUIDv4Type"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:pattern value="[a-f0-9]{8}-[a-f0-9]{4}-4[a-f0-9]{3}-[ab89]{1}[a-f0-9]{3}-[a-f0-9]{12}"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:schema> <xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-complex-types:v7" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:tns="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-complex-types:v7" xmlns:st="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-simple-types:v6" xmlns:edbheader="http://edb.com/ws/WSCommon_v21"> <xs:import namespace="http://edb.com/ws/WSCommon_v21"/> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-simple-types:v6"/> <xs:complexType name="PartyIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: Set of elements used to identify a person or an organisation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="name" type="st:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name by which a party is known and which is usually used to identify that party."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="postalAddress" type="tns:PostalAddress"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined by postal services."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="faxNumber" type="st:PhoneNumber"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="emailAddress" type="st:Max254Text"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="contactDetailsName" type="st:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name of person to receive information."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PostalAddress"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>PAYS can do validations against the country code (depending on which party/agent type it is). All other fields is information only, and is sent to Payment Engine without any form of validation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="addressType" type="tns:AddressTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO "Identifies the nature of the postal address. Values: ADDR, PBOX, HOME, BIZZ, MLTO, DLVY</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="department" type="st:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identification of a division of a large organisation or building."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="subDepartment" type="st:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identification of a sub-division of a large organisation or building."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="streetName" type="st:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name of a street or thoroughfare."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="buildingNumber" type="st:Max16Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Number that identifies the position of a building on a street."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="postCode" type="st:Max16Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identifier consisting of a group of letters and/or numbers that is added to a postal address to assist the sorting of mail."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="townName" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name of a built-up area, with defined boundaries, and a local government."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="countrySubDivision" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identifies a subdivision of a country such as state, region, county."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="country" type="st:CountryCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Nation with its own government."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="7" minOccurs="0" name="addressLine" type="st:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined by postal services, presented in free format text."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="AddressTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="ADDR"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the complete postal address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PBOX"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is a postal office (PO) box.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="HOME"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the home address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="BIZZ"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the business address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MLTO"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the address to which mail is sent.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DLVY"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the address to which delivery is to take place.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="FinancialInstitutionIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Set of elements used to uniquely and unambiguously identify a financial institution or a branch of a financial institution."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="bic" type="st:BICFIIdentifier"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Code allocated to a financial institution by the ISO 9362 Registration Authority as described in ISO 9362; Banking - Banking telecommunication messages - Business identifier code (BIC)."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="nationalId" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Depending on validations against PBD, will be mapped against the following ISO fields: 1: MemberIdentification - "Identification of a member of a clearing system" 2: Other - ""Unique identification of an agent, as assigned by an institution, using an identification scheme Regarding 1, PAYS will also add a ClearingSystemIdentification to uniquely identify the agent within the correct clearing system of that country. This ID can be found in ISO's ExternalCodeList overview.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="name" type="st:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name by which an agent is known and which is usually used to identify that agent."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="postalAddress" type="tns:PostalAddress"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ExchangeRate"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="exchangeRate" type="st:BaseOneRate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "The factor used for conversion of an amount from one currency to another. This reflects the price at which one currency was bought with another currency.""</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element default="SPOT" minOccurs="0" name="rateType" type="st:ExchangeRateTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the type used to complete the currency exchange." Values: SPOT, SALE, AGRD</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="contractIdentification" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unique and unambiguous reference to the foreign exchange contract agreed between the initiating party/creditor and the debtor agent."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentIdentification"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="messageIdentification" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Point to point reference, as assigned by the instructing party, and sent to the next party in the chain to unambiguously identify the message." Usage: The instructing party has to make sure that MessageIdentification is unique per instructed party for a pre-agreed period.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="endToEndIdentification" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unique identification assigned by the initiating party to unumbiguously identify the transaction. This identification is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain. " NB! endToendIdentification will remain unchanged in updates (as opposed to other ids return in create response. This field is therefore a good canditate to follow a payment in audit trail.)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AmountTypeChoice"> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice> <xs:element name="instructedAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="equivalentAmount" type="tns:EquivalentAmount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, expressed in the currency of the debtor's account, and the currency in which the amount is to be moved.""</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EquivalentAmount"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="tns:Amount"/> <xs:element name="currencyOfTransfer" type="st:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the currency of the to be transferred amount, which is different from the currency of the debtor's account."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Account"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Provides the details to identify an account.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="identification" type="st:Max34Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Account identifier; IBAN or other generic identifier</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="currency" type="st:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Identification of the currency in which the account is held.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Amount"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="st:Amount_SimpleType"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="currency" type="st:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Balance"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="st:Balance_SimpleType"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="currency" type="st:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AmountOptionalCurrency"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="st:Amount_SimpleType"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="currency" type="st:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode" use="optional"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentAmounts"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Contains information regarding debit and credit amount along with counter values and conversionRate info. At least one of debitCounterValue and creditCounterValue is always set. This information is always recalculated in Read/Search</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="debitAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be deducted from the debtor, expressed in the debtor account currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="creditAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be transferred to the creditor, expressed in the transfer currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="debitCounterValue" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be deducted from the debtor, expressed in the base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditCounterValue" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be transferred to the creditor, expressed in the base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="conversionRateInfo" type="tns:ConversionRateInfo"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Rate used to convert between the debit and credit amount.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ConversionRateInfo"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="rate" type="st:BaseOneRate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "The factor used for conversion of an amount from one currency to another. This reflects the price at which one currency was bought with another currency."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="type" type="tns:ConversionRateTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the type of rate used when performing exchange rate conversion." Values: NONE, AGREED_RATE, SELL_RATE, BUY_RATE, MID_RATE, CROSS_RATE</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="unitNumber"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Describes the unit number. Possible values: 1 and 100.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:simpleType> <xs:restriction base="xs:int"> <xs:enumeration value="1"/> <xs:enumeration value="100"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="ConversionRateTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="NONE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>No conversion has been done.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="AGREED_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using an agreed rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SELL_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a sell rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="BUY_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a buy rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MID_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a mid rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="CROSS_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a cross rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="RegulatoryReporting"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Information needed due to regulatory and statutory requirements.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="code" type="st:Max10Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the nature, purpose, and reason for the transaction to be reported for regulatory and statutory requirements in a coded form. " A PBD-service can provide these codes.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="information" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Additional details that cater for specific domestic regulatory requirements.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="InstructionForCreditorAgent"> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Creditor agent instructions (either predefined code words, or proprietary code words for use in older exchange formats)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:element name="code" type="tns:InstructionForCreditorAgentCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Coded information related to the processing of the payment instruction, provided by the initiating party, and intended for the creditor's agent." Values: CHQB, HOLD, PHOB, TELB</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="proprietaryCode" type="st:Max8Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>non-ISO-20022: "This field can be used for other codeWords/instructions for other payment standards (ISO-15022, etc.). This data will be ignored for ISO-20022 outgoing messages."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="instructionInformation" type="st:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Further information complementing the coded instruction or instruction to the creditor's agent that is bilaterally agreed or specific to a user community."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="InstructionForCreditorAgentCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="CHQB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>(Ultimate) creditor must be paid by cheque.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="HOLD"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount of money must be held for the (ultimate) creditor, who will call. Pay on identification.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PHOB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Please advise/contact (ultimate) creditor/claimant by phone</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TELB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Please advise/contact (ultimate) creditor/claimant by the most efficient means of telecommunication.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="Approval"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="dateOfApproval" type="st:ISODate"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="approverFirstName" type="st:Max35Text"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="approverLastName" type="st:Max35Text"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Approver"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="approverFirstName" type="st:Max35Text"/> <xs:element name="approverLastName" type="st:Max35Text"/> <xs:element name="identification" type="st:Max35Text"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EinvoiceDetails"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>NON-ISO field All details regarding eInvoice.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="invoiceReference" type="st:Max40Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Unique reference of eInvoice.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="providerId" type="st:ProviderId"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>eInvoice provider</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="brandId" type="st:BrandId"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Additional id of an eInvoice provider, e.g 001, 002</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="eInvoiceOwnerId" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The id for the owner of the eInvoice. See also initiatorIdentifier that is the id of the party that initiates the payment.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="eInvoiceType" type="st:EinvoiceType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The type of eInvoice, based on from where it comes from.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ReferredDocumentInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Set of elements used to identify the documents referred to in the remittance information." Typical use: invoice details</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="type" type="st:ReferredDocumentType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the type of referred document." Values: CINV, CREN Default: CINV</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="issuer" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identification of the issuer of the reference document type"</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="number" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unique and unambiguous identification of the referred document."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="relatedDate" type="st:ISODate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Date associated with the referred document."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="invoiceeOtherId" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identification of the party to whom an invoice is issued, when it is different from the debtor or ultimate debtor."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="RemittanceInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information supplied to enable the matching of an entry with the items that the transfer is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="remittanceInformationUnstructured" type="st:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information supplied to enable the matching/reconciliation of an entry with the items that the payment is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system, in an unstructured form."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="remittanceInformationStructured" type="tns:RemittanceInformationStructured"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information supplied to enable the matching/reconciliation of an entry with the items that the payment is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system, in a structured form."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="RemittanceInformationStructured"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="referredDocumentInformation" type="tns:ReferredDocumentInformation"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="referredDocumentAmount" type="tns:ReferredDocumentAmount"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditorReferenceInformation" type="tns:CreditorReferenceInformation"/> <xs:element maxOccurs="3" minOccurs="0" name="additionalRemittanceInformation" type="st:Max140Text"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ReferredDocumentAmount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Provides details on the amounts of the referred document.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="duePayableAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount specified is the exact amount due and payable to the creditor.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditNoteAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount specified for the referred document is the amount of a credit note.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="remittedAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount specified for the referred document is the amount of a credit note.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="CreditorReferenceInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Reference information provided by the creditor to allow the identification of the underlying documents.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="type" type="st:CreditorReferenceInformationType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Type of creditor reference, in a coded form Values: DISP, FXDR, PUOR, RADM, RPIN, SCOR</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="issuer" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Entity that assigns the credit reference type</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="reference" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Unique reference, as assigned by the creditor, to unambiguously refer to the payment transaction.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ChequeInstruction"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Set of elements needed to issue a cheque."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="chequeType" type="st:ChequeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the type of cheque to be issued." Values: BCHQ</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="deliveryMethod" type="st:DeliveryMethodType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the delivery method of the cheque by the debtor's agent." Values: MLCD</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="chequeFrom" type="tns:chequeIdentificationType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identifies the party that ordered the issuance of the cheque."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="deliverTo" type="tns:chequeIdentificationType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Party to whom the debtor's agent needs to send the cheque"</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="chequeIdentificationType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="name" type="st:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO "Name by which a party is known and is usually used to identify that identity."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="postalAddress" type="tns:PostalAddress"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO "Postal address of a party"</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="listTransactionResponse"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Placeholder for possible error codes for each transaction within a PaymentListCreate</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="instructionIdentification" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Transaction id, as given by the client.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="transactionId" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Transaction id, as generated by underlying DB.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="releaseDate" type="st:ISODate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>This field shows the earliest possible date for when the this payment will be due date processed. Bank holiday (in debtor bank) and time of day (after last due date process) can affect the release date. con:part.con:content:
<wsdl:definitions targetNamespace="urn:pins.payment.edb.com:ws:paymentstatusupdate:v1_2" xmlns:wsdl="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/" xmlns:tns="urn:pins.payment.edb.com:ws:paymentstatusupdate:v1_2" xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/soap/" xmlns:sch5="urn:pins.payment.edb.com:domain:payment-status-update:v1_2" xmlns:sch4="urn:pays.payment.edb.com:domain:sepa-complex-types:v4" xmlns:sch3="urn:pays.payment.edb.com:domain:sepa-simple-types:v3" xmlns:sch2="urn:pays.payment.edb.com:domain:edb-types:v1" xmlns:sch1="http://edb.com/ws/WSCommon_v21" xmlns:sch0="urn:pins.payment.edb.com:ws:paymentstatusupdate:v1_2"> <wsdl:types> <xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="urn:pins.payment.edb.com:ws:paymentstatusupdate:v1_2" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:pay="urn:pins.payment.edb.com:domain:payment-status-update:v1_2" xmlns:edb="urn:pays.payment.edb.com:domain:edb-types:v1"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Operations for updating status of payments. All operations can be performed on message, account, paymentInformation and transcation level. Short explanation of the statuses (see supplementary documentation for further details) Confirm: validated -> toBeApproved | validated -> readyForDueDate (if approval is not used) Approve: toBeApproved -> readyForDueDate | toBeApproved -> toBeApproved (if more than 1 approval needed) Unapprove: readyForDueDate -> toBeApproved Cancel: * -> cancelled Prioritize: readyForDueDate -> readyForDueDate w/priority mark Unprioritize: readyForDueDate w/priority mark -> readyForDueDate Stop: readyForDueDate -> stopped Reactivate: stopped -> readyForDueDate
Error Conditions (responseState.ErrorCode): 70=Technical error (Uncategorized) 6426=No payments found for status update (Validation) 6485=Not authorized for accounts (Validation) 6549=Required account identification (Account as input) 6600=Status update failed for all matching payments. Refer to ResultCode of individual StatusUpdateResults for detailed information
Validation conditions (responseState.ErrorCode) 6601=Status update failed for some matching payments. Refer to ResultCode of individual StatusUpdateResults for detailed information
In case of 6600/6601 the response will include a StatusUpdateResultCode for each payment: SUCCESS=Payment updated successfully UNAUTHORIZED=User not authorized to perform requested operation on payment. ILLEGAL_STATUS_UPDATE=Payment cannot be updated from its current status to the requested status. PARTIALLY_APPROVED=Payment approved successfully, but more approvals are needed to fully approve payment. (This status is only used for paymentApprove). ALREADY_APPROVED_BY_USER=Payment already approved by current user. (This status is only used for paymentApprove). NO_APPROVALS_NEEDED=Customer agreement does not require payment approval. (This status is only used for paymentApprove/Unapprove). AMOUNT_EXCEEDS_AGREED_LIMIT=Payment amount exceeds the approval amount limit on the debit account (This status is only used for paymentApprove).
If no payments matches the requested criteria, an error will be thrown. If at least one payment fulfills the requested criteria, a validation error will be added for each failing payment.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:import namespace="urn:pays.payment.edb.com:domain:edb-types:v1"/> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.edb.com:domain:payment-status-update:v1_2"/> <xs:element name="PaymentApproveRequest" type="tns:PaymentApproveRequestType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Request to Approve payment(s)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="PaymentApproveResponse" organisation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="name" type="st:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name by which a party is known and
