value="SALARY_LIST"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from a salary file</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PAYMENT_LIST"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from a payment list file</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PREPAID_LIST"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from a prepaid list file</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="UNKNOWN"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Unknown origin (migrated?)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:schema> <xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="urn:pays.payment.edb.com:domain:sepa-complex-types:v1" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:tns="urn:pays.payment.edb.com:domain:sepa-complex-types:v1" xmlns:st="urn:pays.payment.edb.com:domain:sepa-simple-types:v1"> <xs:import namespace="urn:pays.payment.edb.com:domain:sepa-simple-types:v1"/> <xs:complexType name="PartyIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: Set of elements used to identify a person or an organisation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="name" type="st:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name by which a party is known and which is usually used to identify that party."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="postalAddress" type="tns:PostalAddress"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined by postal services."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="faxNumber" type="st:PhoneNumber"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PostalAddress"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>PAYS can do validations against the country code (depending on which party/agent type it is). All other fields is information only, and is sent to Payment Engine without any form of validation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="addressType" type="tns:AddressTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO "Identifies the nature of the postal address. Values: ADDR, PBOX, HOME, BIZZ, MLTO, DLVY</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="department" type="st:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identification of a division of a large organisation or building."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="subDepartment" type="st:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identification of a sub-division of a large organisation or building."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="streetName" type="st:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name of a street or thoroughfare."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="buildingNumber" type="st:Max16Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Number that identifies the position of a building on a street."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="postCode" type="st:Max16Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identifier consisting of a group of letters and/or numbers that is added to a postal address to assist the sorting of mail."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="townName" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name of a built-up area, with defined boundaries, and a local government."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="countrySubDivision" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identifies a subdivision of a country such as state, region, county."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="country" type="st:CountryCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Nation with its own government."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="7" minOccurs="0" name="addressLine" type="st:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined by postal services, presented in free format text."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="AddressTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="ADDR"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the complete postal address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PBOX"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is a postal office (PO) box.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="HOME"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the home address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="BIZZ"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the business address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MLTO"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the address to which mail is sent.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DLVY"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the address to which delivery is to take place.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="FinancialInstitutionIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Set of elements used to uniquely and unambiguously identify a financial institution or a branch of a financial institution."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="bic" type="st:BICFIIdentifier"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Code allocated to a financial institution by the ISO 9362 Registration Authority as described in ISO 9362; Banking - Banking telecommunication messages - Business identifier code (BIC)."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="nationalId" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Depending on validations against PBD, will be mapped against the following ISO fields: 1: MemberIdentification - "Identification of a member of a clearing system" 2: Other - ""Unique identification of an agent, as assigned by an institution, using an identification scheme Regarding 1, PAYS will also add a ClearingSystemIdentification to uniquely identify the agent within the correct clearing system of that country. This ID can be found in ISO's ExternalCodeList overview.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="name" type="st:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name by which an agent is known and which is usually used to identify that agent."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="postalAddress" type="tns:PostalAddress"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ExchangeRate"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="exchangeRate" type="st:BaseOneRate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "The factor used for conversion of an amount from one currency to another. This reflects the price at which one currency was bought with another currency.""</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element default="SPOT" minOccurs="0" name="rateType" type="tns:ExchangeRateTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the type used to complete the currency exchange." Values: SPOT, SALE, AGRD</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="contractIdentification" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unique and unambiguous reference to the foreign exchange contract agreed between the initiating party/creditor and the debtor agent."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="ExchangeRateTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="SPOT"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Exchange rate applied is the rate agreed between the parties.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SALE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Exchange rate applied is the market rate at the time of the sale.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="AGRD"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Exchange rate applied is the rate agreed between the parties.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentIdentification"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="messageIdentification" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Point to point reference, as assigned by the instructing party, and sent to the next party in the chain to unambiguously identify the message." Usage: The instructing party has to make sure that MessageIdentification is unique per instructed party for a pre-agreed period.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="endToEndIdentification" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unique identification assigned by the initiating party to unumbiguously identify the transaction. This identification is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain. " NB! endToendIdentification will remain unchanged in updates (as opposed to other ids return in create response. This field is therefore a good canditate to follow a payment in audit trail.)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AmountTypeChoice"> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice> <xs:element name="instructedAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="equivalentAmount" type="tns:EquivalentAmount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, expressed in the currency of the debtor's account, and the currency in which the amount is to be moved.""</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EquivalentAmount"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="tns:Amount"/> <xs:element name="currencyOfTransfer" type="st:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the currency of the to be transferred amount, which is different from the currency of the debtor's account."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Account"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Provides the details to identify an account.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="identification" type="st:Max34Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Account identifier; IBAN or other generic identifier</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="currency" type="st:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Identification of the currency in which the account is held.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Amount"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="st:Amount_SimpleType"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="currency" type="st:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentAmounts"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Contains information regarding debit and credit amount along with counter values and conversionRate info. At least one of debitCounterValue and creditCounterValue is always set. This information is always recalculated in Read/Search</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="debitAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be deducted from the debtor, expressed in the debtor account currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="creditAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be transferred to the creditor, expressed in the transfer currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="debitCounterValue" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be deducted from the debtor, expressed in the base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditCounterValue" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be transferred to the creditor, expressed in the base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="conversionRateInfo" type="tns:ConversionRateInfo"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Rate used to convert between the debit and credit amount.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ConversionRateInfo"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="rate" type="st:BaseOneRate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "The factor used for conversion of an amount from one currency to another. This reflects the price at which one currency was bought with another currency."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="type" type="tns:ConversionRateTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the type of rate used when performing exchange rate conversion." Values: NONE, AGREED_RATE, SELL_RATE, BUY_RATE, MID_RATE, CROSS_RATE</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="unitNumber"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Describes the unit number. Possible values: 1 and 100.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:simpleType> <xs:restriction base="xs:int"> <xs:enumeration value="1"/> <xs:enumeration value="100"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="ConversionRateTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="NONE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>No conversion has been done.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="AGREED_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using an agreed rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SELL_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a sell rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="BUY_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a buy rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MID_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a mid rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="CROSS_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a cross rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="RegulatoryReporting"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Information needed due to regulatory and statutory requirements.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="code" type="st:Max10Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the nature, purpose, and reason for the transaction to be reported for regulatory and statutory requirements in a coded form. " A PBD-service can provide these codes.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="information" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Additional details that cater for specific domestic regulatory requirements.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="InstructionForCreditorAgent"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="code" type="tns:InstructionForCreditorAgentCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Coded information related to the processing of the payment instruction, provided by the initiating party, and intended for the creditor's agent." Values: CHQB, HOLD, PHOB, TELB</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="instructionInformation" type="st:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Further information complementing the coded instruction or instruction to the creditor's agent that is bilaterally agreed or specific to a user community."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="InstructionForCreditorAgentCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="CHQB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>(Ultimate) creditor must be paid by cheque.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="HOLD"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount of money must be held for the (ultimate) creditor, who will call. Pay on identification.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PHOB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Please advise/contact (ultimate) creditor/claimant by phone</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TELB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Please advise/contact (ultimate) creditor/claimant by the most efficient means of telecommunication.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="Approval"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="dateOfApproval" name="ISODate"> <xs:restriction base="xs:date"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ISODateTime"> <xs:restriction base="xs:dateTime"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="Max15NumericText"> <xs:documentation>All transaction charges are to be borne by the debtor.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="CRED"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>All transaction charges are to be borne by the creditor.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SHAR"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>In a credit transfer context, means that transaction charges on the sender side are to be borne by the debtor, transaction charges on the receiver side are to be borne by the creditor. In a direct debit context, means that transaction charges on the sender side are to be borne by the creditor, transaction charges on the receiver side are to be borne by the debtor.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SLEV"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Charges are to be applied following the rules agreed in the service level and/or scheme.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ChargeInfoTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="TOTP"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Total amount in base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TOTA"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Total amount in account currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DNBP"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Product charge specified in base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DNBT"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Product charge specified in the transfer currency deducted from the transfer amount. Pertains only to outgoing payments where charges on the sender side are to be borne by the beneficiary.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="OURP"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Charges on the beneficiary side to be borne by the sender in base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="OURA"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Charges on the beneficiary side to be borne by the sender in account currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PRO1"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>From ProFX: 1 = Debited account separately.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PRO2"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>From ProFX: 2 = Accumulated and debited/invoiced at intervals.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PRO3"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>From ProFX: 3 = Fees deducted from transferred amount.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="PriorityCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="HIGH"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Priority level is high.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="NORM"> <xs:annotation> <wsdl:definitions targetNamespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:ws:paymentinitiation:v1_9" xmlns:wsdl="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/" xmlns:tns="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:ws:paymentinitiation:v1_9" xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/soap/" xmlns:sch7="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:nationalinformation-nor:v1_2" xmlns:sch6="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:paymentinitiation:v1_9" xmlns:sch5="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:creditor:v1_7" xmlns:sch4="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:debtor:v1_7" xmlns:sch3="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-complex-types:v7" xmlns:sch2="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-simple-types:v6" xmlns:sch1="http://edb.com/ws/WSCommon_v21" xmlns:sch0="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:ws:paymentinitiation:v1_9"> <wsdl:types> <xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:ws:paymentinitiation:v1_9" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:st="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-simple-types:v6" xmlns:pay="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:paymentinitiation:v1_9" xmlns:nor="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:nationalinformation-nor:v1_2" xmlns:ct="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-complex-types:v7"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Services for Creating, Updating and Reading payments.
Error Conditions (responseState.ErrorCode): 0=OK [validation warnings can appear in errorItems] 10=Bad or missing input 12=No data found 13=Duplicate entry 26=Unknown bank 59=Insufficient funds 70=Technical error 373=Logical duplicate 383=Payment failed due to technical error 464=Receiving account is not valid for real-time payments 466=Invalid security (MAC,crypto,sign) 467=Unexpected transaction change 6000=Validation error [When this ErrorCode is received, you need to check responseState.errorItem for the specific error items, shown below] 6438=Unknown transaction id (Update/Read) 6439=Not a unique payment. Duplicate keys found. 6484=No agreement can be found for this user. 6485=Not authorized for accounts 6489=Not authorized for transaction id 6602=Payment status is not valid for update 6603=Not authorized for operation 6700=Validation error where all transactions in payment list failed, [When this ErrorCode is received, you need to check responseState.errorItem for the specific error items per transaction, shown below] 6701=Validation error where some transactions in payment list failed, [When this ErrorCode is received, you need to check responseState.errorItem for the specific error items per transaction, shown below] 6614=Customer information not found
Validation errors (can be found in responseState.errorItem): 59=Insufficient funds 69=User not authorized for service 419=Invalid due date 465=The requested amount exceeds the allowable limit for real-time payments 6401=Invalid creditor agent identification (Creditor agent) 6402=Invalid creditor account number (Creditor account) 6403=Invalid creditor account number length (Creditor account) 6405=Creditor agent country not open for trade (Creditor agent) 6406=Invalid creditor country code (Creditor) 6407=Blocking found for payment (Warnings and blockings rules) 6408=Counter values can not be calculated due to missing foreign exchange rates for transfer currency (Foreign exchange rate) 6409=Creditor country is missing (Creditor) 6411=Requested execution date passes max forwarding days (Execution date) 6412=Invalid regulatory reporting code (Regulatory reporting) 6413=Regulatory reporting info required (Regulatory reporting) 6414=Transaction amount limit exceeded (Amount limit) 6415=Periodic amount limit exceeded (Amount limit) 6416=Regulatory reporting amount limit reached and no regulatory reporting codes provided (Regulatory reporting) 6429=Creditor name missing (Creditor)
6440=Creditor agent country code missing (Creditor agent) 6441=Invalid debtor agent identification (Debtor) 6445=Invalid format of OCR (Creditor reference) 6446=OCR number is mandatory for the given creditor account.(Creditor account) 6447=Debtor account must be tax account (Debtor account) 6450=User has no access to payment (Domestic payment) 6452=Creditor town name missing (Cheque payment) 6453=Creditor post code missing (Cheque payment) 6454=Creditor account missing (Cheque payment) 6455=No OCR is provided (Norwegian OCR payment) 6458=Invalid identification for intermediary agent 1 (Intermediary agents) 6459=Invalid account number for intermediary agent 1 (Intermediary agents) 6460=Invalid account number length for intermediary agent 1 (Intermediary agents) 6462=Invalid identification for intermediary agent 2 (Intermediary agents) 6463=Invalid account number for intermediary agent 2 (Intermediary agents) 6464=Invalid account number length for intermediary agent 2 (Intermediary agents) 6466=Invalid identification for intermediary agent 3 (Intermediary agents) 6467=Mismatch between country for intermediary agent 1 and BIC (Intermediary agents) 6468=Mismatch between country for intermediary agent 2 and BIC (Intermediary agents) 6469=Mismatch between country for intermediary agent 3 and BIC (Intermediary agents) 6473=Creditor agent identification missing (Creditor agent) 6475=Transfer currency invalid in intermediary agent 1 country (Currency) 6476=Transfer currency invalid in intermediary agent 2 country (Currency) 6477=Transfer currency invalid in intermediary agent 3 country (Currency) 6481=Identification for intermediary agent 1 is missing (Intermediary agents) 6482=Identification for intermediary agent 2 is missing (Intermediary agents) 6483=Identification for intermediary agent 3 is missing (Intermediary agents) 6486=Invalid country for intermediary agent 1 (Intermediary agents) 6487=Invalid country for intermediary agent 2 (Intermediary agents) 6488=Invalid country for intermediary agent 3 (Intermediary agents) 6490=Transfer currency is not valid. (Currency) 6491=Invalid creditor agent country (Creditor agent) 6494=Tax account is not supported for country (Debtor account) 6497=Register amount limit exceeded (Regulatory reporting) 6498=No OCR agreement found 6503=User not authorized for account 6504=Account is invalid, or user is not authorized to use it 6507=Customer Agreement not found 6512=Bank details not found for IBAN 6513=Creditor agent BIC is required 6515=Creditor agent national id is required 6516=Creditor agent national id is mandatory when creditor account is BBAN 6521=Invalid mid-rate 6522=Invalid sell rate 6523=Invalid agreed rate 6525=Market Product could not be determined 6526=Transaction Fee could not be determined 6534=Transfer currency decimal count exceeded 6532=Unable to determine Payment Type 6533=Unable to determine ISPC 6535=Found no match for the supplied BIC 6536=Found no match for the supplied OrgId 6537=The given cheque type code is invalid 6538=The given delivery method code is invalid 6540=Payment amount is equal or below zero 6541=Creditor account should not be present 6542=The given payment method is not a valid payment method 6543=Invalid category purpose 6544=Category purpose code salary cannot be mixed with other codes 6545=CID or message to receiver is present at the same time as structured information 6546=Creditor agent is missing 6547=Cheque instruction not found 6551=Unknown error from Topup Server (prepaid) 6561=Only unstructured remittance information is allowed for cheque payments 6562=Not able to retrieve service information from recharge system (Prepaid card) 6563=Not able to retrieve customer information from recharge system (Prepaid card) 6564=Payment was rejected in recharge system (Prepaid card) 6565=Transaction ok within invalid message (Payment list) 6566=Creditor identification is required (Prepaid card) 6567=Missing Exchange rate 6568=Creditor and Debtor account should not be the same 6569=Service id is required ListCreate (Prepaid card) 6610=Can´t have more than one ISPC for a payment instruction (IPC) 6611=Can not determine ISPC (IPC) 6808=The creditor account must be a valid Norwegian account to qualify for real-time payments 6823=Interim Account not found
Validations warnings (can be found in responseState.errorItem)[payment is stored, user can either ignore warning or do an Update operation to act on those warnings.]: 6404=Requested execution date has passed. Release date has been moved to the next valid bank date. 6410=Cutoff time has passed. Payment might not be released in time for requested execution date (Execution date) 6427=Warning found for payment (Warning and blocking rules) 6456=A similar payment was recently added. Make sure it is not a mistake. (Logical duplicate check) 6470=Release date has been recalculated due to bank holiday in debtor agent country (Execution date) 6471=Release date has been recalculated due to bank holiday in initiator agent country (Execution date) 6472=Payment may not be released in time for requested execution date and will be released on the next valid bank day (Execution date) 6424=Transaction is close to SEPA, but transfer currency is not EUR (SEPA) 6425=Transaction is close to SEPA, but instruction priority is not NORM (SEPA) 6492=Transaction is close to SEPA, but charge bearer is not SHAR (SEPA) 6493=Transaction is close to SEPA, but creditor account number is not an IBAN (SEPA)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:import This has been given in create/update/transactionSearch response.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="paymentReference" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Unique reference to this payment. This has been given in create/update/transactionSearch response.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentHistoricReadResponseType"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="ct:baseResponseType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="paymentResult" type="pay:PaymentHistoricReadResult"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentListCreateRequestType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="paymentListCreateMessage" type="pay:PaymentListCreateMessage"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentListCreateResponseType"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="ct:baseResponseType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="paymentResult" type="pay:PaymentListResult"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> </xs:schema> <xsd:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="http://edb.com/ws/WSCommon_v21" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns="http://edb.com/ws/WSCommon_v21"> <xsd:complexType name="ClientContextType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="userid" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies the person who initiated the action This could either be the customer itself in a netbank) or an employee</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="credentials" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Authorization data. This is typically a security Object retriewed from a logon, but can also be a plain password.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="channel" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicated what type of application that initiated the request</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="orgid" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The OrganizationalId - will in a banking context be Financial Institution / Konsernnr</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="orgunit" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Organizational unit will in a banking context be Branch / Registernr</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="customerid" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Id of the customer on which the operation is requested, may be the same as userid, but may well be different</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="locale" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Locale in a java syntax e.g "en_EN". May be used if application supports localized response</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ip" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The ip adress of the client</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="item" nillable="true" type="itemType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Optionnal extention items - Add key/value pairs for application specific extentions</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="itemType"> <xsd:attribute name="key" type="xsd:string" use="required"/> <xsd:attribute name="value" type="xsd:string" use="required"/> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="EDBHeaderType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="SourceApplication" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies the source that initiated the message. Used to separate different service consumers.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="DestinationApplication" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies the destination of the message. Used to separate different service providers.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Function" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies the service to be called.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Version" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Service version "X.Y.Z" according to this standard: X = Main release (major changes, not necessarily backwards compatible) Y = Minor release (backwards compatible, new functionality) Z = Bugfix (backwards compatible, error correction only)</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ClientContext" type="ClientContextType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Elements for identifying client context information.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:element name="AutHeader" type="EDBHeaderType"/> <xsd:complexType name="ResponseStateType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="ErrorCode" type="xsd:int"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Numeric error code reported for this error.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Severity" type="xsd:int"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Response Status Severity Code</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ComponentId" type="xsd:int"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Unique code identifying the component returning the service response</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="StrErrorCode" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Deprecated: Error code represented as String</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Message" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Message describing the error. Default is english language. Optionally localized according to the locale parameter in the service request</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="NativeError" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Deprecated: Optional detailed error information reported from involved components. Used for diagnostics purposes.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="LogSequence" nillable="true" type="xsd:long"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Optional key generated to be used for log correlation purposes.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="errorItem" nillable="true" type="errorItemType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Optional extention items - key/value pairs are used for extented error inforamtion.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="errorItemType"> <xsd:annotation/> <xsd:attribute name="key" type="xsd:string" use="required"/> <xsd:attribute name="value" type="xsd:string" use="required"/> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:schema> <xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-simple-types:v6" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-simple-types:v6"> <xs:simpleType name="ISODate"> <xs:restriction base="xs:date"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ISODateTime"> <xs:restriction base="xs:dateTime"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="Max15NumericText"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:pattern value="[0-9]{1,15}"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DecimalNumber"> <xs:restriction base="xs:decimal"> <xs:fractionDigits value="17"/> <xs:totalDigits value="18"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="BaseOneRate"> <xs:restriction base="xs:decimal"> <xs:fractionDigits value="10"/> <xs:totalDigits value="11"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="Amount_SimpleType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:decimal"> <xs:fractionDigits value="5"/> <xs:totalDigits value="18"/> <xs:minInclusive value="0"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="Balance_SimpleType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:decimal"> <xs:fractionDigits value="5"/> <xs:totalDigits value="18"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="Amount_SimpleType_NoFractions"> <xs:restriction base="xs:decimal"> <xs:fractionDigits value="0"/> <xs:totalDigits value="12"/> <xs:minInclusive value="0"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ChargeBearerTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="DEBT"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>All transaction charges are to be borne by the debtor.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="CRED"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>All transaction charges are to be borne by the creditor.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SHAR"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>In a credit transfer context, means that transaction charges on the sender side are to be borne by the debtor, transaction charges on the receiver side are to be borne by the creditor. In a direct debit context, means that transaction charges on the sender side are to be borne by the creditor, transaction charges on the receiver side are to be borne by the debtor.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SLEV"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Charges are to be applied following the rules agreed in the service level and/or scheme.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ChargeInfoTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="TOTP"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Total amount in base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TOTA"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Total amount in account currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DNBP"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Product charge specified in base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DNBT"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Product charge specified in the transfer currency deducted from the transfer amount. Pertains only to outgoing payments where charges on the sender side are to be borne by the beneficiary.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="OURP"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Charges on the beneficiary side to be borne by the sender in base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="OURA"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Charges on the beneficiary side to be borne by the sender in account currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PRO1"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>From ProFX: 1 = Debited account separately.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PRO2"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>From ProFX: 2 = Accumulated and debited/invoiced at intervals.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PRO3"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>From ProFX: 3 = Fees deducted from transferred amount.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="PriorityCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="HIGH"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Priority level is high.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="NORM"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Priority level is normal.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="BICFIIdentifier"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:pattern value="[A-Z]{6,6}[A-Z2-9][A-NP-Z0-9]([A-Z0-9]{3,3}){0,1}"/> <xs:minLength value="8"/> <xs:maxLength value="11"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:pattern value="[A-Z]{3,3}"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="CountryCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:pattern value="[A-Z]{2,2}"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="OriginalFormatCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="CLIENT_GENERATED"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from a client.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ISO"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from an ISO file</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="NDR"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from a NDR file</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TELEPAY"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from a Telepay file</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PAYMUL"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from a Paymul file</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SALARY_LIST"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from a salary file</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PAYMENT_LIST"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from a payment list file</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PREPAID_LIST"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from a prepaid list file</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="STANDING_ORDER_FILE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from a standing order file</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="STANDING_ORDER_ONLINE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from an online standing order</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="UNKNOWN"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Unknown origin (migrated?)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="PaymentTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="DOMESTIC_CURRENCY_HIGH_PRIORITY"> <xs:annotation> This service level will indicate that the payment initiation system should mark the eInvoice as ready for due date/paid in the external system, i.e. NETS. This is a proprietary EVRY code (not ISO-20022 complient)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="LocalInstrumentCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identification of a sub-division of a large organisation or building."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="streetName" type="st:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name of a street or thoroughfare."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="buildingNumber" type="st:Max16Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Number that identifies the position of a building on a street."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="postCode" type="st:Max16Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identifier consisting of a group of letters and/or numbers that is added to a postal address to name="addressLine" type="st:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined by postal services, presented in free format text."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="AddressTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="ADDR"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the complete postal address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PBOX"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="BIZZ"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the business address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MLTO"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the address to which mail is sent.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DLVY"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the address to which delivery is to take place.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="FinancialInstitutionIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Set of elements used to uniquely and unambiguously identify a financial institution or a branch of a financial institution."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="bic" type="st:BICFIIdentifier"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Code allocated to a financial </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="nationalId" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Depending on validations against PBD, will be mapped against the following ISO fields: PAYS will also add a ClearingSystemIdentification to uniquely identify the agent within the correct clearing system of that country. This ID can be found in ISO's ExternalCodeList overview.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="name" type="st:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name by which an agent is known and which is usually used to identify that agent."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="postalAddress" type="tns:PostalAddress"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ExchangeRate"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="exchangeRate" type="st:BaseOneRate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "The factor used for conversion of an amount from one currency to another. This reflects the price at which one currency was bought with another currency.""</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element default="SPOT" minOccurs="0" name="rateType" type="st:ExchangeRateTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the type used to complete the currency exchange." Values: SPOT, SALE, AGRD</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="contractIdentification" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unique and unambiguous reference to the foreign exchange contract agreed between the initiating party/creditor and the debtor agent."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentIdentification"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="messageIdentification" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Point to point reference, as assigned by the instructing party, and sent to the next party in the chain to unambiguously identify the message." Usage: The instructing party has to make sure that MessageIdentification is unique per instructed party for a pre-agreed period.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="endToEndIdentification" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unique identification assigned by the initiating party to unumbiguously identify the transaction. This identification is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain. " NB! endToendIdentification will remain unchanged in updates (as opposed to other ids return in create response. This field is therefore a good canditate to follow a payment in audit trail.)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AmountTypeChoice"> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice> <xs:element name="instructedAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="equivalentAmount" type="tns:EquivalentAmount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, expressed in the currency of the debtor's account, and the currency in which the amount is to be moved.""</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EquivalentAmount"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="tns:Amount"/> <xs:element name="currencyOfTransfer" type="st:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the currency of the to be transferred amount, which is different from the currency of the debtor's account."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Account"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Provides the details to identify an account.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="identification" type="st:Max34Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Account identifier; IBAN or other generic identifier</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="currency" type="st:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Identification of the currency in which the account is held.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Amount"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="st:Amount_SimpleType"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="currency" type="st:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Balance"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="st:Balance_SimpleType"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="currency" type="st:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AmountOptionalCurrency"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="st:Amount_SimpleType"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="currency" type="st:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode" use="optional"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentAmounts"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Contains information regarding debit and credit amount along with counter values and conversionRate info. At least one of debitCounterValue and creditCounterValue is always set. This information is always recalculated in Read/Search</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="debitAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be deducted from the debtor, expressed in the debtor account currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="creditAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be transferred to the creditor, expressed in the transfer currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="debitCounterValue" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be deducted from the debtor, expressed in the base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditCounterValue" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be transferred to the creditor, expressed in the base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="conversionRateInfo" type="tns:ConversionRateInfo"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Rate used to convert between the debit and credit amount.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ConversionRateInfo"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="rate" type="st:BaseOneRate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "The factor used for conversion of an amount from one currency to another. This reflects the price at which one currency was bought with another currency."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="type" type="tns:ConversionRateTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the type of rate used when performing exchange rate conversion." Values: NONE, AGREED_RATE, SELL_RATE, BUY_RATE, MID_RATE, CROSS_RATE</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="unitNumber"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Describes the unit number. Possible values: 1 and 100.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:simpleType> <xs:restriction base="xs:int"> <xs:enumeration value="1"/> <xs:enumeration value="100"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="ConversionRateTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="NONE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>No conversion has been done.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="AGREED_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using an agreed rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SELL_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a sell rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="BUY_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a buy rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MID_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a mid rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="CROSS_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a cross rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="RegulatoryReporting"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Information needed due to regulatory and statutory requirements.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="code" type="st:Max10Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the nature, purpose, and reason for the transaction to be reported for regulatory and statutory requirements in a coded form. " A PBD-service can provide these codes.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="information" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Additional details that cater for specific domestic regulatory requirements.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="InstructionForCreditorAgent"> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Creditor agent instructions (either predefined code words, or proprietary code words for use in older exchange formats)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:element name="code" type="tns:InstructionForCreditorAgentCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Coded information related to the processing of the payment instruction, provided by the initiating party, and intended for the creditor's agent." <xs:documentation>The features that the current user can perform on the transaction.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="result" type="tns:CommonReadResult"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Common read result fields.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="statusReason" type="ct:StatusReason"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The historic status reasons.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="settlement" type="ct:Settlement"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Settlement information.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="operationsArray" type="st:PaymentReadOperation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The features that the current user can perform on the transaction.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="CommonReadResult"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Contains common fields for a read result.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="paymentReference" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Unique reference to this payment.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="transactionId" type="xs:long"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A database id for the transaction (ISO: CreditTransferTransactionInformation) level of the payment. Can be used in subsequent updates/statusUpdates against the transaction level (e.g confirm, approve, stop, reactivate, etc)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="messageId" type="xs:long"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A database id for the message level (ISO: GroupHeader) of the payment. Can be used in subsequent statusUpdates against the message level</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="paymentInfoId" type="xs:long"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A database id for the payment info (ISO: PaymentInformation) level of the payment. Can be used in subsequent statusUpdates against the payment info level</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="initiatorIdentifier" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The party that initiates the payment.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="paymentStatus" type="st:PaymentStatusCode"/> <xs:element name="prioritized" type="xs:boolean"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Indicating if this payment instruction has been set as prioritied by the user. Prioritized payments will be processed first in the due date process to (hopefully) sufficient funds for debtor account.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="originalFormat" type="st:OriginalFormatCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The message's original format. E.g ISO, TELEPAY, NDR, etc</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="releaseDate" type="st:ISODate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>This field shows the earliest possible date for when the this payment will be due date processed. Bank holiday (in debtor bank) and time of day (after last due date process) can affect the release date. Rejected payments do not have a release date.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="rejectionDate" type="st:ISODateTime"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>This field shows the datetime for when this payment was rejected.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="paymentType" type="st:PaymentTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>EVRY internal payment type. See supplementary documentation for further detauls.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="paymentProduct" type="xs:string"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Shows the payment market product this payment is related to. Will be mapped against PBD.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="transactionFee" type="ct:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>An indication of fees connected to sending this payment. The transaction fee is deeply linked to the payment product.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="additionalServiceCharge" type="ct:AdditionalServiceCharge"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Charges for additional services associated with this payment.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="paymentIdentification" type="ct:PaymentIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Set of elements used to reference a payment instruction."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="groupHeader" type="ct:GroupHeader"/> <xs:element name="paymentInfo" type="deb:PaymentInformation"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="transaction" type="tns:CreditTransferTransactionResponseType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Note that this might not be sent in the response. For example, when a user does not have a salary permission, then the creditor side of the payment will not be returned.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="approver" type="ct:ApproverType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Users who has approved</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="agreementDetails" type="ct:AgreementDetails"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Filter payments based on agreement type</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="marketType" type="st:MarketType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Indicates if payment has been generated from corporate (BM) or retail (PM) channel</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="originalChannel" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The channel the payment was originally received/created from</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="paymentAdditionalInfo" type="ct:PaymentAdditionalInfo"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Payment additional info services associated with this payment.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="CreditTransferTransactionRequestType"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="cre:CreditTransferTransaction"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="remittanceInformationUnstructured" type="st:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information supplied to enable the matching/reconciliation of an entry with the items that the payment is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system, in an unstructured form."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditorScorReference" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Used to reference OCR/KID
The ISO reference is RemittanceInformation.Structured.CreditorReferenceInformation.Code/Reference=SCOR, and has been flattened here.
SCOR = StructuredCommunicationReference: Document is a structured communication reference provided by the creditor to identify the referred transaction.
ISO: "Unique reference, as assigned by the creditor, to unambiguously refer to the payment transaction. Usage: If available, the initiating party should provide this reference in the structured remittance information, to enable reconciliation by the creditor upon receipt of the amount of money. If the business context requires the use of a creditor reference or a payment remit identification, and only one identifier can be passed through the end-to-end chain, the creditor's reference or payment remittance identification should be quoted in the end-to-end transaction identification."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="nationalSpecificPaymentRequestInformation" type="ct:NationalSpecificPaymentRequestInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Non-ISO: All information specific to the nation for the payment request can be sent here. See for example: urn:pays.payment.evry.com:domain:nationalinformation:nor:v1 NorwegianPaymentRequestInformation type which contains AvtaleGiro/eInvoice agreement capture, receipt requests, etc. in Norway.
(Note: in the ISO20022 standard, this information could be put in the supplementaryData field)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="CreditTransferTransactionResponseType"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="cre:CreditTransferTransaction"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="remittanceInformation" type="ct:RemittanceInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Invoice details</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="nationalSpecificPaymentInformation" type="ct:NationalSpecificPaymentInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Non-ISO: All information specific to the nation for the payment request can be sent here. See for example: urn:pays.payment.evry.com:domain:nationalinformation:nor:v1 NorwegianPaymentInformation type which contains AvtaleGiro/eInvoice agreement capture, receipt requests, etc. in Norway.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> </xs:schema> <xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:nationalinformation-nor:v1_2" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:tns="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:nationalinformation-nor:v1_2" xmlns:ct="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-complex-types:v7"> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-complex-types:v7"/> <xs:complexType name="NorwegianPaymentRequestInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Non-ISO Norwegian specific payment request information</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="ct:NationalSpecificPaymentRequestInformation"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="agreementCapture" type="tns:AgreementCaptureType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>If the beneficiary offers AvtaleGiro agreements, eInvoice agreements, or both, this might be fetched at payment time and a proposal presented. Use this field to control the proposal fetch. If not defined, no agreement capture will be performed. AVTALEGIRO to fetch potential AvtaleGiro proposals, COMBINATION for fetching proposal which offer both products (e.g. an AvtaleGiroPayment with eInvocing reference). Should only be used for payments with CID defined. If this value is given, a possible agreement capture proposal will be returned in the response for the given AgreementCaptureType. This should only be used for payments with CID defined (see creditorScorReference).</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="receiptOrder" type="tns:ReceiptType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>If this value is given, a receipt will be ordered for the given type. Even though this is available in the paymentUpdateMessage, if this is the only field to update for the payment, consider rather using the PINSPaymentUtil.ReceiptOrderUpdate web service operations which also supports creating receipt orders after the payment has been completed.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="eInvoiceDetails" type="ct:EinvoiceDetails"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>eInvoice details for payments using eInvoice</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="NorwegianNationalPaymentInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Non-ISO Norwegian specific payment information</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="ct:NationalSpecificPaymentInformation"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="agreementProposalCapture" type="tns:AgreementProposalCapture"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Object containing information relevant to agreement capture. I.e. if the payer is registering a bill to a beneficiary offering AvtaleGiro, the payer could be offered an AvtaleGiro proposal immediately.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="receiptOrder" type="tns:ReceiptType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>If this value is given, a receipt will be ordered for the given type. Even though this is available in the paymentUpdateMessage, if this is the only field to update for the payment, consider rather using the PINSPaymentUtil.ReceiptOrderUpdate web service operations which also supports creating receipt orders after the payment has been completed.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="EProviderProposal" type="tns:EProviderProposal"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Contains information about name and status of eInvoice providers.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="eInvoiceDetails" type="ct:EinvoiceDetails"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>eInvoice details for payments using eInvoice</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType abstract="true" name="AgreementProposalCapture"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generic type for all agreement proposal captures</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AvtaleGiroProposalCapture"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Present if a new AvtaleGiro agreement proposal is captured.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="tns:AgreementProposalCapture"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="ProposalId" type="xs:int"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The AvtaleGiro proposal id</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EInvoiceProposalCapture"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Present if a new eInvoice agreement proposal is captured.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="tns:AgreementProposalCapture"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="ProviderId" type="xs:string"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The eFaktura issuer's unique Id inside the Norwegian eFaktura B2C solution.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="BrandId" type="xs:string"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The brand id to the eFaktura provider.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="BrandName" type="xs:string"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The name of the eFaktura provider</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="CustomerReference" type="xs:string"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Consumer electronic invoice reference. A unique identification of the customer to the eFaktura provider.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="ProposalId" type="xs:int"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The eFaktura proposal id</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="CombinationProposalCapture"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Contains both a eInvoiceProposalCapture and an AvtaleGiroProposalCapture</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="tns:AgreementProposalCapture"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="EInvoiceProposalCapture" type="tns:EInvoiceProposalCapture"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Present if a new eFaktura agreement proposal is captured.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="AvtaleGiroProposalCapture" type="tns:AvtaleGiroProposalCapture"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Present if a new AvtaleGiro agreement proposal is captured.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EProviderProposal"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="EInvoiceProvider" nillable="true" type="tns:EInvoiceProviderEnum"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The eInvoice provider which is registered on the customer.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="Status" nillable="true" type="tns:EProviderStatusEnum"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The status on this agreement with the einvoice provider.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="DatePostponed" nillable="true" type="xs:date"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The customer has answered no to sign an agreement with eInvoice provider. The customer will be asked again after this date.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="AgreementCaptureType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="AVTALEGIRO"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Use this value in the request to fetch potential AvtaleGiro agreement proposals</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="COMBINATION"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Use this value in the request for fetching proposals which offer both products (e.g. an AvtaleGiroPayment with eInvoicing reference)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="EInvoiceProviderEnum"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="EINVOICE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Agreement from Nets</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DIGIPOST"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Agreement from Posten</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ECOMMERCE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Agreement from ECOMMERCE</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="EBOX"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Agreement from EBOX</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="EProviderStatusEnum"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="PROSPECT"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Agreement with provider, but no agreement with the bank</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ACTIVE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Agreement with provider and bank</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="POSTPONED"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>An agreement with the bank is not wanted now</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="INACTIVE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Agreement with provider is canceled</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="NOPROSPECT"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>No agreement with provider</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ReceiptType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="STICKER"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Receipt sticker</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PRINT"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Printed receipt</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="NONE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>No receipt</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:schema> </wsdl:types>
