<wsdl:definitions targetNamespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:ws:paymentinitiation:v1_10" xmlns:wsdl="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/" xmlns:tns="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:ws:paymentinitiation:v1_10" xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/soap/" xmlns:sch7="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:nationalinformation-nor:v1_3" xmlns:sch6="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:paymentinitiation:v1_10" xmlns:sch5="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:creditor:v1_8" xmlns:sch4="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:debtor:v1_8" xmlns:sch3="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-complex-types:v8" xmlns:sch2="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-simple-types:v7" xmlns:sch1="http://edb.com/ws/WSCommon_v21" xmlns:sch0="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:ws:paymentinitiation:v1_10"> <wsdl:types> <xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:ws:paymentinitiation:v1_10" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:st="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-simple-types:v7" xmlns:pay="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:paymentinitiation:v1_10" xmlns:nor="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:nationalinformation-nor:v1_3" xmlns:ct="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-complex-types:v8"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Services for Creating, Updating and Reading payments.
Error Conditions (responseState.ErrorCode): 0=OK [validation warnings can appear in errorItems] 10=Bad or missing input 12=No data found 13=Duplicate entry 26=Unknown bank 59=Insufficient funds 70=Technical error 373=Logical duplicate 383=Payment failed due to technical error 464=Receiving account is not valid for real-time payments 466=Invalid security (MAC,crypto,sign) 467=Unexpected transaction change 6000=Validation error [When this ErrorCode is received, you need to check responseState.errorItem for the specific error items, shown below] 6438=Unknown transaction id (Update/Read) 6439=Not a unique payment. Duplicate keys found. 6484=No agreement can be found for this user. 6485=Not authorized for accounts 6489=Not authorized for transaction id 6602=Payment status is not valid for update 6603=Not authorized for operation 6700=Validation error where all transactions in payment list failed, [When this ErrorCode is received, you need to check responseState.errorItem for the specific error items per transaction, shown below] 6701=Validation error where some transactions in payment list failed, [When this ErrorCode is received, you need to check responseState.errorItem for the specific error items per transaction, shown below] 6614=Customer information not found
Validation errors (can be found in responseState.errorItem): 59=Insufficient funds 69=User not authorized for service 419=Invalid due date 465=The requested amount exceeds the allowable limit for real-time payments 6401=Invalid creditor agent identification (Creditor agent) 6402=Invalid creditor account number (Creditor account) 6403=Invalid creditor account number length (Creditor account) 6405=Creditor agent country not open for trade (Creditor agent) 6406=Invalid creditor country code (Creditor) 6407=Blocking found for payment (Warnings and blockings rules) 6408=Counter values can not be calculated due to missing foreign exchange rates for transfer currency (Foreign exchange rate) 6409=Creditor country is missing (Creditor) 6411=Requested execution date passes max forwarding days (Execution date) 6412=Invalid regulatory reporting code (Regulatory reporting) 6413=Regulatory reporting info required (Regulatory reporting) 6414=Transaction amount limit exceeded (Amount limit) 6415=Periodic amount limit exceeded (Amount limit) 6416=Regulatory reporting amount limit reached and no regulatory reporting codes provided (Regulatory reporting) 6429=Creditor name missing (Creditor)
6440=Creditor agent country code missing (Creditor agent) 6441=Invalid debtor agent identification (Debtor) 6445=Invalid format of OCR (Creditor reference) 6446=OCR number is mandatory for the given creditor account.(Creditor account) 6447=Debtor account must be tax account (Debtor account) 6450=User has no access to payment (Domestic payment) 6452=Creditor town name missing (Cheque payment) 6453=Creditor post code missing (Cheque payment) 6454=Creditor account missing (Cheque payment) 6455=No OCR is provided (Norwegian OCR payment) 6458=Invalid identification for intermediary agent 1 (Intermediary agents) 6459=Invalid account number for intermediary agent 1 (Intermediary agents) 6460=Invalid account number length for intermediary agent 1 (Intermediary agents) 6462=Invalid identification for intermediary agent 2 (Intermediary agents) 6463=Invalid account number for intermediary agent 2 (Intermediary agents) 6464=Invalid account number length for intermediary agent 2 (Intermediary agents) 6466=Invalid identification for intermediary agent 3 (Intermediary agents) 6467=Mismatch between country for intermediary agent 1 and BIC (Intermediary agents) 6468=Mismatch between country for intermediary agent 2 and BIC (Intermediary agents) 6469=Mismatch between country for intermediary agent 3 and BIC (Intermediary agents) 6473=Creditor agent identification missing (Creditor agent) 6475=Transfer currency invalid in intermediary agent 1 country (Currency) 6476=Transfer currency invalid in intermediary agent 2 country (Currency) 6477=Transfer currency invalid in intermediary agent 3 country (Currency) 6481=Identification for intermediary agent 1 is missing (Intermediary agents) 6482=Identification for intermediary agent 2 is missing (Intermediary agents) 6483=Identification for intermediary agent 3 is missing (Intermediary agents) 6486=Invalid country for intermediary agent 1 (Intermediary agents) 6487=Invalid country for intermediary agent 2 (Intermediary agents) 6488=Invalid country for intermediary agent 3 (Intermediary agents) 6490=Transfer currency is not valid. (Currency) 6491=Invalid creditor agent country (Creditor agent) 6494=Tax account is not supported for country (Debtor account) 6497=Register amount limit exceeded (Regulatory reporting) 6498=No OCR agreement found 6503=User not authorized for account 6504=Account is invalid, or user is not authorized to use it 6507=Customer Agreement not found 6512=Bank details not found for IBAN 6513=Creditor agent BIC is required 6515=Creditor agent national id is required 6516=Creditor agent national id is mandatory when creditor account is BBAN 6521=Invalid mid-rate 6522=Invalid sell rate 6523=Invalid agreed rate 6525=Market Product could not be determined 6526=Transaction Fee could not be determined 6534=Transfer currency decimal count exceeded 6532=Unable to determine Payment Type 6533=Unable to determine ISPC 6535=Found no match for the supplied BIC 6536=Found no match for the supplied OrgId 6537=The given cheque type code is invalid 6538=The given delivery method code is invalid 6540=Payment amount is equal or below zero 6541=Creditor account should not be present 6542=The given payment method is not a valid payment method 6543=Invalid category purpose 6544=Category purpose code salary cannot be mixed with other codes 6545=CID or message to receiver is present at the same time as structured information 6546=Creditor agent is missing 6547=Cheque instruction not found 6551=Unknown error from Topup Server (prepaid) 6561=Only unstructured remittance information is allowed for cheque payments 6562=Not able to retrieve service information from recharge system (Prepaid card) 6563=Not able to retrieve customer information from recharge system (Prepaid card) 6564=Payment was rejected in recharge system (Prepaid card) 6565=Transaction ok within invalid message (Payment list) 6566=Creditor identification is required (Prepaid card) 6567=Missing Exchange rate 6568=Creditor and Debtor account should not be the same 6569=Service id is required ListCreate (Prepaid card) 6610=Can´t have more than one ISPC for a payment instruction (IPC) 6611=Can not determine ISPC (IPC) 6808=The creditor account must be a valid Norwegian account to qualify for real-time payments 6823=Interim Account not found
Validations warnings (can be found in responseState.errorItem)[payment is stored, user can either ignore warning or do an Update operation to act on those warnings.]: 6404=Requested execution date has passed. Release date has been moved to the next valid bank date. 6410=Cutoff time has passed. Payment might not be released in time for requested execution date (Execution date) 6427=Warning found for payment (Warning and blocking rules) 6456=A similar payment was recently added. Make sure it is not a mistake. (Logical duplicate check) 6470=Release date has been recalculated due to bank holiday in debtor agent country (Execution date) 6471=Release date has been recalculated due to bank holiday in initiator agent country (Execution date) 6472=Payment may not be released in time for requested execution date and will be released on the next valid bank day (Execution date) 6424=Transaction is close to SEPA, but transfer currency is not EUR (SEPA) 6425=Transaction is close to SEPA, but instruction priority is not NORM (SEPA) 6492=Transaction is close to SEPA, but charge bearer is not SHAR (SEPA) 6493=Transaction is close to SEPA, but creditor account number is not an IBAN (SEPA)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:import type.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="RR09"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Structured creditor reference invalid or missing.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="RR10"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Character set supplied not valid for the country and payment type.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="RR11"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Invalid or missing identification of a bank proprietary service.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="RR12"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Invalid or missing identification required within a particular country or payment type.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SL01"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Due to specific service offered by the Debtor Agent</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SL02"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Due to specific service offered by the Creditor Agent</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TA01"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The transmission of the file was not successful - it had to be aborted (for technical reasons)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TD01"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>There is no data available (for download)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TD02"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The file cannot be read (e.g. unknown format)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TD03"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The file format is incomplete or invalid</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TM01"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Associated message, payment information block, or transaction was received after agreed processing cut-off time.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TS01"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The (technical) transmission of the file was successful.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TS04"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The order was transferred to pass by accompanying note signed by hand</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ExchangeRateTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="SPOT"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Exchange rate applied is the rate agreed between the parties.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SALE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Exchange rate applied is the market rate at the time of the sale.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="AGRD"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Exchange rate applied is the rate agreed between the parties.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="EinvoiceType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="EINVOICE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>einvoice from Nets</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DIGIPOST"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>einvoice from Posten</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ECOMMERCE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>einvoice from ECOMMERCE</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="EBOX"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>einvoice from EBOX</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="UUIDv4Type"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:pattern value="[a-f0-9]{8}-[a-f0-9]{4}-4[a-f0-9]{3}-[ab89]{1}[a-f0-9]{3}-[a-f0-9]{12}"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:schema> <xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-complex-types:v8" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:tns="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-complex-types:v8" xmlns:st="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-simple-types:v7" xmlns:edbheader="http://edb.com/ws/WSCommon_v21"> <xs:import namespace="http://edb.com/ws/WSCommon_v21"/> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-simple-types:v7"/> <xs:complexType name="PartyIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: Set of elements used to identify a person or an organisation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="name" type="st:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name by which a party is known and which is usually used to identify that party."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="postalAddress" type="tns:PostalAddress"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined by postal services."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="faxNumber" type="st:PhoneNumber"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="emailAddress" type="st:Max254Text"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="contactDetailsName" type="st:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name of person to receive information."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PostalAddress"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>PAYS can do validations against the country code (depending on which party/agent type it is). All other fields is information only, and is sent to Payment Engine without any form of validation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="addressType" type="tns:AddressTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO "Identifies the nature of the postal address. Values: ADDR, PBOX, HOME, BIZZ, MLTO, DLVY</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="department" type="st:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identification of a division of a large organisation or building."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="subDepartment" type="st:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identification of a sub-division of a large organisation or building."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="streetName" type="st:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name of a street or thoroughfare."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="buildingNumber" type="st:Max16Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Number that identifies the position of a building on a street."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="postCode" type="st:Max16Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identifier consisting of a group of letters and/or numbers that is added to a postal address to assist the sorting of mail."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="townName" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name of a built-up area, with defined boundaries, and a local government."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="countrySubDivision" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identifies a subdivision of a country such as state, region, county."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="country" type="st:CountryCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Nation with its own government."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="7" minOccurs="0" name="addressLine" type="st:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined by postal services, presented in free format text."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="AddressTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="ADDR"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the complete postal address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PBOX"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is a postal office (PO) box.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="HOME"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the home address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="BIZZ"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the business address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MLTO"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the address to which mail is sent.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DLVY"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the address to which delivery is to take place.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="FinancialInstitutionIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Set of elements used to uniquely and unambiguously identify a financial institution or a branch of a financial institution."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="bic" type="st:BICFIIdentifier"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Code allocated to a financial institution by the ISO 9362 Registration Authority as described in ISO 9362; Banking - Banking telecommunication messages - Business identifier code (BIC)."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="nationalId" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Depending on validations against PBD, will be mapped against the following ISO fields: 1: MemberIdentification - "Identification of a member of a clearing system" 2: Other - ""Unique identification of an agent, as assigned by an institution, using an identification scheme Regarding 1, PAYS will also add a ClearingSystemIdentification to uniquely identify the agent within the correct clearing system of that country. This ID can be found in ISO's ExternalCodeList overview.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="name" type="st:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name by which an agent is known and which is usually used to identify that agent."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="postalAddress" type="tns:PostalAddress"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ExchangeRate"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="exchangeRate" type="st:BaseOneRate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "The factor used for conversion of an amount from one currency to another. This reflects the price at which one currency was bought with another currency.""</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element default="SPOT" minOccurs="0" name="rateType" type="st:ExchangeRateTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the type used to complete the currency exchange." Values: SPOT, SALE, AGRD</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="contractIdentification" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unique and unambiguous reference to the foreign exchange contract agreed between the initiating party/creditor and the debtor agent."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentIdentification"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="messageIdentification" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Point to point reference, as assigned by the instructing party, and sent to the next party in the chain to unambiguously identify the message." Usage: The instructing party has to make sure that MessageIdentification is unique per instructed party for a pre-agreed period.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="endToEndIdentification" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unique identification assigned by the initiating party to unumbiguously identify the transaction. This identification is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain. " NB! endToendIdentification will remain unchanged in updates (as opposed to other ids return in create response. This field is therefore a good canditate to follow a payment in audit trail.)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AmountTypeChoice"> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice> <xs:element name="instructedAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="equivalentAmount" type="tns:EquivalentAmount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, expressed in the currency of the debtor's account, and the currency in which the amount is to be moved.""</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EquivalentAmount"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="tns:Amount"/> <xs:element name="currencyOfTransfer" type="st:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the currency of the to be transferred amount, which is different from the currency of the debtor's account."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Account"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Provides the details to identify an account.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="identification" type="st:Max34Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Account identifier; IBAN or other generic identifier</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="currency" type="st:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Identification of the currency in which the account is held.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Amount"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="st:Amount_SimpleType"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="currency" type="st:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Balance"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="st:Balance_SimpleType"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="currency" type="st:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AmountOptionalCurrency"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="st:Amount_SimpleType"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="currency" type="st:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode" use="optional"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentAmounts"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Contains information regarding debit and credit amount along with counter values and conversionRate info. At least one of debitCounterValue and creditCounterValue is always set. This information is always recalculated in Read/Search</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="debitAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be deducted from the debtor, expressed in the debtor account currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="creditAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be transferred to the creditor, expressed in the transfer currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="debitCounterValue" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be deducted from the debtor, expressed in the base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditCounterValue" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be transferred to the creditor, expressed in the base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="conversionRateInfo" type="tns:ConversionRateInfo"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Rate used to convert between the debit and credit amount.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ConversionRateInfo"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="rate" type="st:BaseOneRate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "The factor used for conversion of an amount from one currency to another. This reflects the price at which one currency was bought with another currency."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="type" type="tns:ConversionRateTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the type of rate used when performing exchange rate conversion." Values: NONE, AGREED_RATE, SELL_RATE, BUY_RATE, MID_RATE, CROSS_RATE</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="unitNumber"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Describes the unit number. Possible values: 1 and 100.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:simpleType> <xs:restriction base="xs:int"> <xs:enumeration value="1"/> <xs:enumeration value="100"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="ConversionRateTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="NONE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>No conversion has been done.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="AGREED_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using an agreed rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SELL_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a sell rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="BUY_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a buy rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MID_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a mid rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="CROSS_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a cross rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="RegulatoryReporting"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Information needed due to regulatory and statutory requirements.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="code" type="st:Max10Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the nature, purpose, and reason for the transaction to be reported for regulatory and statutory requirements in a coded form. " A PBD-service can provide these codes.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="information" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Additional details that cater for specific domestic regulatory requirements.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="InstructionForCreditorAgent"> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Creditor agent instructions (either predefined code words, or proprietary code words for use in older exchange formats)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:element name="code" type="tns:InstructionForCreditorAgentCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Coded information related to the processing of the payment instruction, provided by the initiating party, and intended for the creditor's agent." Values: CHQB, HOLD, PHOB, TELB</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="proprietaryCode" type="st:Max8Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>non-ISO-20022: "This field can be used for other codeWords/instructions for other payment standards (ISO-15022, etc.). This data will be ignored for ISO-20022 outgoing messages."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="instructionInformation" type="st:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Further information complementing the coded instruction or instruction to the creditor's agent that is bilaterally agreed or specific to a user community."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="InstructionForCreditorAgentCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="CHQB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>(Ultimate) creditor must be paid by cheque.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="HOLD"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount of money must be held for the (ultimate) creditor, who will call. Pay on identification.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PHOB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Please advise/contact (ultimate) creditor/claimant by phone</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TELB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Please advise/contact (ultimate) creditor/claimant by the most efficient means of telecommunication.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="Approval"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="dateOfApproval" type="st:ISODate"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="approverFirstName" type="st:Max35Text"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="approverLastName" type="st:Max35Text"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Approver"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="approverFirstName" type="st:Max35Text"/> <xs:element name="approverLastName" type="st:Max35Text"/> <xs:element name="identification" type="st:Max35Text"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EinvoiceDetails"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>NON-ISO field All details regarding eInvoice.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="invoiceReference" type="st:Max200Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Unique reference of eInvoice.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="providerId" type="st:ProviderId"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>eInvoice provider</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="brandId" type="st:BrandId"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Additional id of an eInvoice provider, e.g 001, 002</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="eInvoiceOwnerId" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The id for the owner of the eInvoice. See also initiatorIdentifier that is the id of the party that initiates the payment.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="eInvoiceType" type="st:EinvoiceType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The type of eInvoice, based on from where it comes from.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ReferredDocumentInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Set of elements used to identify the documents referred to in the remittance information." Typical use: invoice details</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="type" type="st:ReferredDocumentType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the type of referred document." Values: CINV, CREN Default: CINV</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="issuer" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identification of the issuer of the reference document type"</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="number" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unique and unambiguous identification of the referred document."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="relatedDate" type="st:ISODate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Date associated with the referred document."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="invoiceeOtherId" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identification of the party to whom an invoice is issued, when it is different from the debtor or ultimate debtor."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="RemittanceInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information supplied to enable the matching of an entry with the items that the transfer is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="remittanceInformationUnstructured" type="st:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information supplied to enable the matching/reconciliation of an entry with the items that the payment is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system, in an unstructured form."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="remittanceInformationStructured" type="tns:RemittanceInformationStructured"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information supplied to enable the matching/reconciliation of an entry with the items that the payment is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system, in a structured form."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="RemittanceInformationStructured"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="referredDocumentInformation" type="tns:ReferredDocumentInformation"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="referredDocumentAmount" type="tns:ReferredDocumentAmount"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditorReferenceInformation" type="tns:CreditorReferenceInformation"/> <xs:element maxOccurs="3" minOccurs="0" name="additionalRemittanceInformation" type="st:Max140Text"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ReferredDocumentAmount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Provides details on the amounts of the referred document.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="duePayableAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount specified is the exact amount due and payable to the creditor.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditNoteAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount specified for the referred document is the amount of a credit note.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="remittedAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount specified for the referred document is the amount of a credit note.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="CreditorReferenceInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Reference information provided by the creditor to allow the identification of the underlying documents.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="type" type="st:CreditorReferenceInformationType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Type of creditor reference, in a coded form Values: DISP, FXDR, PUOR, RADM, RPIN, SCOR</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="issuer" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Entity that assigns the credit reference type</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="reference" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Unique reference, as assigned by the creditor, to unambiguously refer to the payment transaction.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ChequeInstruction"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Set of elements needed to issue a cheque."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="chequeType" type="st:ChequeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the type of cheque to be issued." Values: BCHQ</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="deliveryMethod" type="st:DeliveryMethodType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the delivery method of the cheque by the debtor's agent." Values: MLCD</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="chequeFrom" type="tns:chequeIdentificationType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identifies the party that ordered the issuance of the cheque."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="deliverTo" type="tns:chequeIdentificationType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Party to whom the debtor's agent needs to send the cheque"</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="chequeIdentificationType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="name" type="st:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO "Name by which a party is known and is usually used to identify that identity."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="postalAddress" type="tns:PostalAddress"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO "Postal address of a party"</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="listTransactionResponse"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Placeholder for possible error codes for each transaction within a PaymentListCreate</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="instructionIdentification" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Transaction id, as given by the client.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="transactionId" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Transaction id, as generated by underlying DB.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="releaseDate" type="st:ISODate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>This field shows the earliest possible date for when the this payment will be due date processed. Bank holiday (in debtor bank) and time of day (after last due date process) can affect the release date. Rejected payments do not have a release date.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="errorItem" type="tns:errorItemType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>List of error codes. If list is missing, transaction has been created successfully.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="warningItem" type="tns:warningItemType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>List of warning codes. If list is missing, transaction has been created with no warnings.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="errorItemType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Key/value pair holding error Code and error message</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:attribute name="errorCode" type="xs:string" use="required"/> <xs:attribute name="errorMessage" type="xs:string" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="warningItemType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Key/value pair holding warning code and warning message</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:attribute name="warningCode" type="xs:string" use="required"/> <xs:attribute name="warningMessage" type="xs:string" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AgreementDetails"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Possibility to search for payments with certain agreements</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="agreementType" type="st:AgreementType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Agreement type, e.g Standing Order, Avtalegiro and Loan</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="agreementId" type="tns:AgreementId"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AgreementId"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Agreement id and version</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="id" type="st:Max18Long"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The unique id of the agreement.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="version" type="st:Max18Long"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Some agreements can have an additional version field. Can be used here to narrow down to a specific version of the agreement</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AdditionalServiceCharge"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Charges for additional services</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="serviceName" type="xs:string"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The name of the additional service</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="charge" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The charge associated with the additional service</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ApproverType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="userid" type="st:Max35Text"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="name" type="st:Max140Text"/> <xs:element name="dateOfApproval" type="st:ISODateTime"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="GroupHeader"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Set of characteristics shared by all individual transactions included in the message.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creationDateTime" type="st:ISODateTime"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>CreationDateTime is set by PAYS in all request operations. Can therefore be omitted in all requests. It is added here to be included in the response (e.g for Read operation)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Settlement"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="debitAmount" type="tns:SettlementAmount"/> <xs:element name="bookingDate" type="st:ISODateTime"/> <xs:element name="valueDate" type="st:ISODateTime"/> <xs:element name="reference" type="st:Max35Text"/> <xs:element name="creditAmount" type="tns:SettlementAmount"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="interbankSettlementDate" type="st:ISODate"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="debitAmountCounterValue" type="tns:SettlementAmount"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditAmountCounterValue" type="tns:SettlementAmount"/> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="chargeInfo" type="tns:SettlementChargeInfo"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="SettlementAmount"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="tns:Amount"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="exchangeInfo" type="tns:CurrencyExchangeInfo"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="CurrencyExchangeInfo"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="sourceCurrency" type="st:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="targetCurrency" type="st:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="unitCurrency" type="st:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode"/> <xs:element name="exchangeRate" type="st:BaseOneRate"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="contractIdentification" type="st:Max35Text"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="quotationDate" type="st:ISODateTime"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="SettlementChargeInfo"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="chargedAmount" type="tns:Amount"/> <xs:element name="type" type="st:ChargeInfoTypeCode"/> <xs:element name="bearer" type="st:ChargeBearerTypeCode"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="DateCriteria"> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="accurateDate" type="st:ISODate"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="dateFromTo" type="tns:DateFromTo"/> </xs:choice> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="DateFromTo"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="fromDate" type="st:ISODate"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="toDate" type="st:ISODate"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AmountCriteria"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Accurate, max or min amount, aggregate accurate, or aggregate max or min amount. Amount will match against both InstructedAmount and Equivalent Amount. Note that for equivalentAmount the currencyCode will NOT be mapped against currencyOfTransfer. The non-aggregated filters will match single payments, while the aggregated filters will match the aggregated sums of payments per grouping (grouping depends on which search is being performed, i.e. mesage level, payment info level, etc.)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="accurateAmount" type="st:Amount_SimpleType"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="amountMaxMin" type="tns:AmountMaxMin"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="aggregatedAccurateAmount" type="st:Amount_SimpleType"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="aggregatedAmountMaxMin" type="tns:AmountMaxMin"/> </xs:choice> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="currencyCode" type="st:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AmountMaxMin"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="minAmount" type="st:Amount_SimpleType"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="maxAmount" type="st:Amount_SimpleType"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="SumAmountType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="sumAmount" type="tns:AggregatedAmountType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Sum amount for payments</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="accumulatedAmounts" type="tns:AccumulatedAmountType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>List of accumulated instructed amounts for each Amount Currency Code</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AggregatedAmountType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="sumAmountBaseCurrency" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Sum amount for payments calculated in base currency</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="sumAmount" type="st:Amount_SimpleType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Sum amount for all selected payments independently of currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AccumulatedAmountType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="accumulatedAmount" type="tns:Amount"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="StatusReason"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="code" type="st:StatusReasonCode"/> <xs:element name="message" type="st:Max170Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Additional message explaining the reason. Might come from the external system without any modifications</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="sourceSystem" type="st:Max35Text"/> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="additionalInfo" type="st:Max105Text"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType abstract="true" name="NationalSpecificPaymentRequestInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Non-ISO: Generic type for all information specific to the nation for the request (for example AvtaleGiro/eInvoice capture, receipt requests, etc. in Norway). This type is used in the WS request objects (i.e. agreement capture request)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType abstract="true" name="NationalSpecificPaymentInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Non-ISO: Generic type for all information specific to the nation for the request (for example AvtaleGiro/eInvoice capture proposals, receipt requests, etc. in Norway). This type is used in the WS response objects (i.e. agreement proposal response).</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType abstract="true" name="baseResponseType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="ResponseState" type="edbheader:ResponseStateType"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentAdditionalInfo"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Payment additional information</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="debitValueDate" type="xs:string"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The Debit value date rule</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditValueDate" type="xs:string"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The Credit value date rule</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ChargeOption"> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Either, indication of whether payment's original charge should be preserved or not, or specification of an explicit charge that should be applied.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:element name="preserveOriginalChargeParameters" type="xs:boolean"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Indicates whether the payment's original initiatorId and channel should be preserved when charge is retrieved. Setting this to false means that charge will be retrieved based on the current userId and PaymentChannel.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="charge" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The charge to be applied to the payment.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EditPaymentOptions"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="chargeOption" type="tns:ChargeOption"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> </xs:schema> <xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:debtor:v1_8" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:tns="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:debtor:v1_8" xmlns:st="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-simple-types:v7" xmlns:ct="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-complex-types:v8"> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-simple-types:v7"/> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-complex-types:v8"/> <xs:complexType name="PaymentInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Set of characteristics that applies to the debit side of the payment transactions included in the credit transfer initiation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="paymentMethod" type="tns:PaymentMethodCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the means of payment that will be used to move the amount of money." Values: CHK, TRA, TRF. DNB payment engine only accepts TRF.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="paymentTypeInformation" type="tns:PaymentTypeInformation"/> <xs:choice> <xs:element name="requestedExecutionDate" type="st:ISODate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Date at which the initiating party requests the clearing agent to process the payment. Usage: This is the date on which the debtor's account is to be debited. If payment by cheque, the date when the cheque must be generated by the bank.""</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="requestedCreditValueDate" type="st:ISODate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The requested credit value date for the payment. Can be given as an alternative to requestedExecutionDate. This is the date on which the creditor's account is to be credited.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> <xs:element name="debtorAccount" type="ct:Account"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unambiguous identification of the account of the debtor to which a debit entry will be made as a result of the transaction"</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="debtorAgentBIC" type="st:BICFIIdentifier"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>BIC of debtor agent. Only needs to be provided if debtor agent is other than initiator agent, e.g. for foreign account purposes. If left out, PI will set debtorAgent=initiatorAgent.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="debtor" type="ct:PartyIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Party that owes an amount of money to the (ultimate) creditor."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="ultimateDebtor" type="ct:PartyIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Ultimate party that owes an amount of money to the (ultimate) creditor."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="instructionForDebtorAgent" type="st:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Further information related to the processing of the payment instruction, that may need to be acted upon by the debtor agent, depending on agreement between debtor and the debtor agent. Usage: when present, then the instructions for the debtor agent apply for all credit transfer transaction information occurrences, present in the payment information."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="PaymentMethodCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="CHK"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Written order to a bank to pay a certain amount of money from one person to another person.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TRF"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Transfer of an amount of money in the books of the account servicer.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentTypeInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Set of elements used to further specify the type of transaction.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="instructionPriority" type="st:PriorityCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Urgency or order of importance that the originator would like the recipient of the payment instruction to apply to the processing of the payment instruction."
Values: HIGH, NORM
Default: NORM</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="serviceLevel" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Agreement under which or rules under which the transaction should be processed"
Values: URGP, NRTP, INTD, EINV, NRTR, DRDB, GLMS
Default: (none)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="localInstrument" type="st:LocalInstrumentCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "User community specific instrument. Usage: This element is used to specify a local instrument, local clearing option and/or further qualify the service or service level."
Values: TO BE DECIDED! (not an enum yet..)
Default:</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="categoryPurpose" type="st:CategoryPurposeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the high level purpose of the instruction based on a set of pre-defined categories. Usage: This is used by the initiating party to provide information concerning the processing of the payment. It is likely to trigger special processing by any of the agents involved in the payment chain."
For banks using DNB Payment engine for international payments: PI will set this value based on instructionPriority.
Values: INVS, SALA, IDCP, CASH, CORT, INTC, PENS, SSBE, SUPP, TAXS, TREA, VATX, LOAN, OTHR
Default: SUPP</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> </xs:schema> <xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:creditor:v1_8" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:st="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-simple-types:v7" xmlns:ct="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-complex-types:v8" xmlns="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:creditor:v1_8"> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-complex-types:v8"/> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-simple-types:v7"/> <xs:complexType name="CreditTransferTransaction"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Provides information on the individual transaction(s) included in the message."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="ct:AmountTypeChoice"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="exchangeRateInformation" type="ct:ExchangeRate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Provides details on the currency exchange rate and contract."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="chargeBearer" type="st:ChargeBearerTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies which party/parties will bear the charges associated with the processing of the payment transaction." Values: SHAR, DEBT, CRED, SLEV Default set by PAYS if missing in request: SHAR</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="intermediaryAgent1" type="ct:FinancialInstitutionIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Agent #1 between the debtor's agent and the creditor's agent."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="intermediaryAgent2" type="ct:FinancialInstitutionIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Agent #2 between the debtor's agent and the creditor's agent."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="intermediaryAgent3" type="ct:FinancialInstitutionIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Agent #3 between the debtor's agent and the creditor's agent.""</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditorAgent" type="ct:FinancialInstitutionIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Financial institution servicing an account for the creditor."
Optional only when PaymentType is Cheque</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditor" type="ct:PartyIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Party to which an amount of money is due."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditorAccount" type="ct:Account"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unambiguous identification of the account of the creditor to which a credit entry will be posted as a result of the payment transaction."
Optional only when PaymentType is Cheque</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="ultimateCreditor" type="ct:PartyIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Ultimate party to which an amount of money is due.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="instructionForCreditorAgent" type="ct:InstructionForCreditorAgent"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Further information related to the processing of the payment instruction, provided by the initiating party, and intended for the creditor agent."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="regulatoryReporting" type="ct:RegulatoryReporting"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Information needed due to regulatory and statutory requirements."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="internalNote" type="st:Max40Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Internal note, not part of the ISO standard.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="confidential" type="xs:boolean"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Confidential flag. Payments created/updated with this flag will only show in Search if user has Confidential role.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="chequeInstruction" type="ct:ChequeInstruction"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Set of elements needed to issue a cheque."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:choice minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Purp - Underlying reason for the payment transaction."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:element name="purposeCode" type="st:Max4Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>See ISO "Payment Purpose Code" external code set for valid values</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="purposeProprietary" type="st:Max35Text"/> </xs:choice> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="uetrId" type="st:UUIDv4Type"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Unique End-to-End Transaction Reference contains UUID compliant with version 4 of standard RFC4122</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="SimpleCreditTransferTransaction"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Provides information on the individual transaction(s) included in the message." Here: a simplified transaction compared to CreditTransferTransactiond-element.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="instructionIdentification" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unique identification as assigned by an instructing party for an instructed party to unambiguously identify the instruction" Usage: the instruction identification is a point to point reference that can be used between the instructing party and the instructed party to refer to the individual instruction. It can be included in several messages related to the instruction.
Client must provide each transaction an id in order to link possible error codes in the response with the erroneous transaction.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="customerId" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Identifies customer connected to the prepaid card in the recharge system. Mandatory when PaymentList Type is IDCP Recharge Pre pay cards</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="amount" type="ct:AmountTypeChoice"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party."
Since paymentList only support domestic payments, it would only make sense to use instructed amount.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="creditorName" type="st:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Party to which an amount of money is due." Here: simplified to only use name.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditorAccount" type="ct:Account"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unambiguous identification of the account of the creditor to which a credit entry will be posted as a result of the payment transaction."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="remittanceInformationUnstructured" type="st:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information supplied to enable the matching/reconciliation of an entry with the items that the payment is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system, in an unstructured form."
Here: limit to only 1 x 140 characters</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditorScorReference" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Used to reference OCR/KID
The ISO reference is RemittanceInformation.Structured.CreditorReferenceInformation.Code/Reference=SCOR, and has been flattened here.
SCOR = StructuredCommunicationReference: Document is a structured communication reference provided by the creditor to identify the referred transaction.
ISO: "Unique reference, as assigned by the creditor, to unambiguously refer to the payment transaction. Usage: If available, the initiating party should provide this reference in the structured remittance information, to enable reconciliation by the creditor upon receipt of the amount of money. If the business context requires the use of a creditor reference or a payment remit identification, and only one identifier can be passed through the end-to-end chain, the creditor's reference or payment remittance identification should be quoted in the end-to-end transaction identification."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="confidential" type="xs:boolean"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Confidential flag. Payments created/updated with this flag will only show in Search if user has Confidential role.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> </xs:schema> <xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:paymentinitiation:v1_10" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:tns="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:paymentinitiation:v1_10" xmlns:st="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-simple-types:v7" xmlns:deb="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:debtor:v1_8" xmlns:ct="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-complex-types:v8" xmlns:cre="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:creditor:v1_8"> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-complex-types:v8"/> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-simple-types:v7"/> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:debtor:v1_8"/> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:creditor:v1_8"/> <xs:complexType name="PaymentCreateMessage"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The payment initiation message can contain only one payment information and one credit transfer transaction.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="paymentIdentification" type="ct:PaymentIdentification"/> <xs:element name="paymentInfo" type="deb:PaymentInformation"/> <xs:element name="transaction" type="tns:CreditTransferTransactionRequestType"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="referredDocumentInformation" type="ct:ReferredDocumentInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Invoice details</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="autoConfirm" type="xs:boolean"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Indicates that the payment should be automatically confirmed. Setting this to false means that the payment will only be validated, and requires a separate confirm request to be processed.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="retailPaymentApprovalNeeded" type="xs:boolean"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Indicates that the payment should be set to status TO_BE_APPROVED once confirmed instead of READY_FOR_DUE_DATE.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentListCreateMessage"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Can contain 1 debtor account and multiple creditors (account, agent), which effectively makes this a 1-to-many payment.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="messageIdentification" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Point to point reference, as assigned by the instructing party, and sent to the next party in the chain to unambiguously identify the message." Usage: The instructing party has to make sure that MessageIdentification is unique per instructed party for a pre-agreed period.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="paymentListType" type="st:PaymentListType"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="serviceId" type="st:Max35Text"/> <xs:choice> <xs:element name="requestedExecutionDate" type="st:ISODate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Date at which the initiating party requests the clearing agent to process the payment. Usage: This is the date on which the debtor's account is to be debited. If payment by cheque, the date when the cheque must be generated by the bank.""</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="requestedCreditValueDate" type="st:ISODate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The requested credit value date for the payment.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> <xs:element name="debtorAccount" type="ct:Account"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unambiguous identification of the account of the debtor to which a debit entry will be made as a result of the transaction"</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="debtor" type="ct:PartyIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Party that owes an amount of money to the (ultimate) creditor."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" name="transactions" type="cre:SimpleCreditTransferTransaction"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>List of CreditTransferTransactions. The transactions are a simplified version of the transactions used in PaymentCreate/Update. Why? 1: Only support domestic payments lists with limited functionality 2: A lot of values can be set to default values, and are therefore hidden here.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentUpdateMessage"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The information needed to update a payment. This is only applicable for employees.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="autoConfirm" type="xs:boolean"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Indicates that the payment should be automatically confirmed. Setting this to false means that the payment will only be validated, and requires a separate confirm request to be processed.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="retailPaymentApprovalNeeded" type="xs:boolean"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Indicates that the payment should be set to status TO_BE_APPROVED once confirmed instead of READY_FOR_DUE_DATE.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentResult"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The complete payment instruction result.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="messageId" type="xs:long"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A database id for the message level (ISO: GroupHeader) of the payment. Can be used in subsequent statusUpdates against the message level</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="paymentInfoId" type="xs:long"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A database id for the payment info (ISO: PaymentInformation) level of the payment. Can be used in subsequent statusUpdates against the payment info level</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="transactionId" type="xs:long"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A database id for the transaction (ISO: CreditTransferTransactionInformation) level of the payment. Can be used in subsequent updates/statusUpdates against the transaction level (e.g confirm, approve, stop, reactivate, etc)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="initiatorIdentifier" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The party that initiates the payment.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="paymentReference" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Unique reference to this payment.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="paymentAmounts" type="ct:PaymentAmounts"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="releaseDate" type="st:ISODate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>This field shows the earliest possible date for when the this payment will be due date processed. The ISO reference is RemittanceInformation.Structured.CreditorReferenceInformation.Code/Reference=SCOR, and has been flattened here.
SCOR = StructuredCommunicationReference: Document is a structured communication reference provided by the creditor to identify the referred transaction.
ISO: "Unique reference, as assigned by the creditor, to unambiguously refer to the payment transaction. Usage: If available, the initiating party should provide this reference in the structured remittance information, to enable reconciliation by the creditor upon receipt of the amount of money. If the business context requires the use of a creditor reference or a payment remit identification, and only one identifier can be passed through the end-to-end chain, the creditor's reference or payment remittance identification should be quoted in the end-to-end transaction identification."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="nationalSpecificPaymentRequestInformation" type="ct:NationalSpecificPaymentRequestInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Non-ISO: All information specific to the nation for the payment request can be sent here. See for example: urn:pays.payment.evry.com:domain:nationalinformation:nor:v1 NorwegianPaymentRequestInformation type which contains AvtaleGiro/eInvoice agreement capture, receipt requests, etc. in Norway.
(Note: in the ISO20022 standard, this information could be put in the supplementaryData field)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="CreditTransferTransactionResponseType"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="cre:CreditTransferTransaction"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="remittanceInformation" type="ct:RemittanceInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Invoice details</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="nationalSpecificPaymentInformation" type="ct:NationalSpecificPaymentInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Non-ISO: All information specific to the nation for the payment request can be sent here. Use this field to control the proposal fetch. If not defined, no agreement capture will be performed. AVTALEGIRO to fetch potential AvtaleGiro proposals, COMBINATION for fetching proposal which offer both products (e.g. an AvtaleGiroPayment with eInvocing reference). Should only be used for payments with CID defined. If this value is given, a possible agreement capture proposal will be returned in the response for the given AgreementCaptureType. This should only be used for payments with CID defined (see creditorScorReference).</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="receiptOrder" type="tns:ReceiptType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>If this value is given, a receipt will be ordered for the given type. Even though this is available in the paymentUpdateMessage, if this is the only field to update for the payment, consider rather using the PINSPaymentUtil.ReceiptOrderUpdate web service operations which also supports creating receipt orders after the payment has been completed.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="eInvoiceDetails" type="ct:EinvoiceDetails"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>eInvoice details for payments using eInvoice</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="NorwegianNationalPaymentInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Non-ISO Norwegian specific payment information</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="ct:NationalSpecificPaymentInformation"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="agreementProposalCapture" type="tns:AgreementProposalCapture"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Object containing information relevant to agreement capture. I.e. if the payer is registering a bill to a beneficiary offering AvtaleGiro, the payer could be offered an AvtaleGiro proposal immediately.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="receiptOrder" type="tns:ReceiptType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>If this value is given, a receipt will be ordered for the given type. Even though this is available in the paymentUpdateMessage, if this is the only field to update for the payment, consider rather using the PINSPaymentUtil.ReceiptOrderUpdate web service operations which also supports creating receipt orders after the payment has been completed.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="EProviderProposal" type="tns:EProviderProposal"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Contains information about name and status of eInvoice providers.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation>
